reviewText:
Don't mind the in-game time, mostly because I cannot even start the game from Steam.

Short version: potential wasted and not enough skill from Trion to stop the hackers. Plus, Trion is a TERRIBLE company.

Long version:

I played from Day-1 (Gamanek here) until November 2014. I bought the Silver Pack and played 2 months, everyday, constantly, with also a guild under my command (a medium-large guild with 20+ members).

Things began to fall apart as soon as more people kicked in: after the problem of the constantly full servers dissipated, the real problem began: hackers, bots and whatnot. All the land for housing was taken before you could even click it, thanks to an exploit regarding your character not actually being near the house, but letting the game think you're there, clicking to place the house.

Housing is actually REQUIRED in the game, in order to create most of the things, without housing you're in for AN HELL HOT farm, and a lot of social demanding (knowing crafters, farm money for them, pay them, rinse&repeat) plus, obviously, the actual fun of the game being locked away from you. There are ways of circumventing this: have a friend pay the monthly subscription (you need it to being able to pay the taxes for the houses) and you then use his/her house. Still, you need that actual friend to do it for you. And find a spot for the house.

After the house problem, there is the gilda problem: everything for housing costs Gilda Stars: every single advanced bench for your house vary in cost, and you need to pay also designs for house, scarecrows and a lot of things. These stars can be acquired through the chapters of the storyline (which at one point obviously ends) and doing daily things. The daily things, though, are somewhat boring things and sometime even HARD (like killing a certain number of monters which spawn in a precise hour of the day, without getting partied because there are already 1 or 2 full parties) plus, the range for things to be bought is around 250 gilda, while you make AT BEST 5-8 gilda PER DAY.

The fighting mechanics are okay, not Guild Wars quality, but still bearable, PVP is obviously I've got the best equipment" and overall the game COULD BE really good. However
date: terrible company behaviour and a lot of unhappy mechanics really make this game fall apart.\nIf you've got money to waste on this
recommended: play FFXIV instead. IF you've got no money
hoursPlayed: then try this out
voteText: and go away when you're bored.\n\nDON'T PAY FOR THIS."

reviewText:
It was a great game.. in beta.. then it launched.

Played this game in beta and then again about a month and a half after it launched. I couldn't log in as a free2play player during launch due to the ridiculous login queues. That's been fixed however. When I finally decided to start seriously giving it a shot, I bought a month of patron and started from scratch.

2 weeks into the game I got a thunderstruck tree from my 5th ever planted pine tree. I planted it outside of a farm and got extremely lucky imo that it wasn't stolen. From that tree, I made 4 logs and gave one to a guild mate, sold the other two and made one into a farm cart. The gold I got from the logs bought my second month of Patron.

At that point, I felt like I could keep playing this game if I was able to pay for sub time with gold. I felt I was off to a good start. Then the economy took a huge hit and a special type of tree was added to the cash shop via an RNG box. That box turned the player market upside down. Prices of the Thunderstruck Logs(not trees) and Prices of APEX(ArcheAge's subscription time in-game item) completely flipped. One became the other. APEX when I first bought it was 80-90 gold each and logs were several hundred gold. When I left game, it was the opposite. After logging in again since last year, the prices haven't changed much. To get a month of game time, you need 600-700 gold, but since logs are cheap(70-90G), you can make a farm cart rather easily and just start farming the gold.

I never got past level 35 and I stopped questing at around level 21. Trade Packs leveled me from 21 to 35 and probably would of gotten me to the level cap had I continued. I knew a good way of making gold too, so I probably would of been able to earn my APEX had I kept at it. However, the game ran like ♥♥♥♥ on my computer. It still does, but I've learned that its a hardware issue on my end(parts are starting to die).

All that pails in comparison to the fact that there is no plots available if you start playing now. If you buy a month or two of Patron(which honestly, if you want to play the real game, then you're gonna have to), you will eventually get an 8x8 scarecrow lot. Its pretty good for growing things and if you have multiple characters, you could make a 16x16 with 4 characters on one server via the 8x8's on the temp gardens. They only allow 8x8's, but after a week the plots are demolished. All the permanent lots are taken and some are purposely taken in a certain position that doesn't allow for other lots to be placed near it.

Example: Say theres a spot that can fit 4 16x16 lots evenly. There's more than likely that one guy who instead of evenly placing his lot in a corner, will place it one space towards the center, thus screwing over 3 other potential 16x16's. Sure, you could fit some 8x8's in there, but really, the 16x16 is the desired lot you would want for farming.. it can fit a lot more tall trees and thus more chances at thunderstruck trees. Plus it allows for a hell of a lot more farming, which in turn is more trade packs being run for gold or gilda stars..

In the end, I reinstalled this game simply to write this review. I do not wish to play it anymore and will move onto better games. Black Desert being one. I can play that game 100x better than ArcheAge ever ran, and that game isn't even released in Korea yet.. Its a sad truth that ArcheAge had potential to be a great game, but XL GAMES ruined it with a lot of bad moves. Maybe they are ideas in Korea, but here not so much. With all the blunders that happened, so many people left the game. So many people wanted it to be a great game.

And it is, as long as you keep giving Trion and XL GAMES your money. Maybe one day I'll try again, but its very doubtful..

reviewText: Genral Feeling Towards This Game -->  :( Frowney face sums it up, but seriously,\n\nIve been a steam user for a very long time and have over 300 games in my account but this is the first game that has angered me so completely that I felt compelled to write a review. It all started years and years ago when I started playing wow in alpha and continued to play that for years but eventually got bored of it. I had been looking for a new MMO to play but never really found one I enjoyed as much. Then I heard about arche age and was quite excited at the prospects of gameplay that they had promised. The thought of a somewhat dynamic world as far as raiding players castles and pirating was quite appealing. I was promised a game that was NOT P2W but rather actually required one to play the game in order to advance rather than just opening up your wallet. I paid a fairly decent amount for this game when it come out only to find out that they had deceived me and many others as to what they were actually getting in the pre-order pack. On top of all of these P2W issues the game itself is not very interesting and I got board of it almost as soon as I started playing because it gives you too much too soon. By like lvl 6 or something you get a mount, so everyone has one. In other MMO’s one must earn their mount and when one is seen riding one you know they have been playing for a while to earn that mount. The graphics in the game are about the only thing that is done well but it doesn’t even come close to redeeming this huge waste of time and money. Additionally I have learned that even if you uninstall the game and Glyph there is still a “anti-cheating” program titled “Eagle64” which apparently records things like your IP address whether you like it or not. Luckily I found a way to delete this stupid thing and I am finally free of all the shackles that came along with this polished turd. For anyone else who wants to be fully rid of this game heres the link http://forums.archeagegame.com/showthread.php?75534-Instructions-for-uninstalling-Hackshield

reviewText:
3/28/2015 JPN time.

I would avoid this it all costs, let me tell you why.


I was a founder and got into the closed beta the second time it was open the game was not too bad then, at that time the game was preforming pretty well and i had a good frame rate, I was running at max settings for everything. Then the game came out.......  I had early access to the game considering i was a founder, so i was able play (i think) 4 or 5 days early, Or well would have if it wasn't for the fact that the severs where either down becuase of DoS or being over capped. When i was finally able to play it seemed like they screwed up the game pretty good. i got very low frames in any places that had more then 10 people, I should have maxed the game 40 times over and yet it chugged around. Also the P2W is strong with this one, makes it way unfair for anyone who wants to play the game with out dumping money into the gold farmer market. If you think this is bad wait until you hear this...  After the realese of the game and seeing how poorly the game was preforming i decided to get my money back from the founder pack, i had bought it off steam and considering i was playing by early access the game was not out on steam yet, under steam guidelines it was considered a pre-order so i requested that i get my money back, i was refunded after i explained why i wanted a refund and all that stuff,  but now i hear that i was one of the lucky ones becuase this game fell into a grey area. Well after alot of people asking for refunds Steam took the game off the market. A few days later i got a email from Trion saying i bought the game by a fraudulent way and my account was banned, Not that i cared or anything. I feel like i dont need to explain the game play that much do to the fact that besides of a huge focus on the social aspect and the guild support and class system the game does not stand out that much agianst other MMO's therefore the game play is almost the same with others in its class.

reviewText:
Just over 90 hours in, and the only real word that comes to mind is 'meh'.

The game looks beautiful, although the cut scenes are terrible. I don't know if they're intentionally going for an ultra low resolution look or what, but they look awful. They also tend to drag on and on.

There seems to be some interesting things to do, like build a house, grow things, craft things, etc but none of them are presented in a very exciting way, and just left me wondering if there was any point to pursuing them.

The story seems very forced, and largely irrelevant.

Not once did I drop below 80% health or 90% mana. Not once. There's also big arrows at your feet pointing you towards all your goals. Maybe at higher levels the game eventually takes off the training wheels, but I got so bored of 'move foward a few steps, hit 4, hit 3, 3, 3, loot, move foward a few steps, hit 4, hit 3, 3, 3, loot, turn in and get another quest to kill some kobolds, repeat.

I want to like this game, but there's nothing in it that's come close to drawing my interest.

reviewText:
When including the amount of time i spent playing the non-steam client of Archeage I would say I must have spent around 2000 hours on the game and I had a lot of fun playing Archeage, but at the same time the game is extremely pay to win and grindy. Launch was plagued by issues and then in November a couple of big exploits were discovered (publicly at least) for which a large number of exploiters were never punished and ill-gotten gains were allowed to severely grant advantages and effect the economy.
As I started off by saying though, I did have a lot of fun playing Archeage. The fishing + tradepack mechanics added something I havent experienced in an MMORPG before. The sandbox nature of AA is also something that sadly isnt present in the majority of AAA MMORPGs, and the lack of instances really helped the open world pvp flourish back when the servers were full and going to freedrich as a full 50 man raid would lead to you having to fight to hold onto your tradepacks.

tl;dr Really good game spoiled by exploits and developers/producers more interested in milking customers via the cash shop. Hopefully other developers arent put off putting out sandbox open world MMORPGs as there is a demand.

This game was my favourite game of 2014 and it's completely destroyed by the F2P" model.

reviewText:
Labour System - get rid - this seriously is off putting.
Put drops back in the game, not a single pelt, armor, weapon, level 20+ still running around with level 10 equipment, can't craft nothing because... labour points, can't progress unless you enjoy feeling like your mentally being rammed into a brick wall, because... labour points, want to open that loot purse you just got, hey better have some labour points ready! Want to gather crafting items... labour points. You get the picture.
Most stupid system ever deployed; Labour points - it sucks the fun completely out of the game and makes my computer cry when the client needs to stay open overnight to tick over patron bonus's to try and get at least 20mins of 'fun' the next day.
Having to spent 12+hours waiting for labour points for an extremely short period of non-combat function is a bit on the rediculous side, c'mon.

I know it's a hard thing to balance out the games economics, but at the moment, there is no economics, the lowest level items cost rediculous amounts of money because dusts are extremely over priced, not enough lewt in quests to make up for it, no drops other than quest items and coin purses.

As for bugs themselves, minimal, seems to be a slight issue with textures if the games running too long (textures get sucked away), other than that, seems fairly well made, it's pretty, the animations are pretty. There's the odd terrain glitch, floaty trees, rocks you can get trapped behind etc. I'm sure they'll get fixed, unlike other games, right?

The most hillarious feature of this game, by far, without a doubt, the justice system - whereby criminals are judged by a jury of their peers and the stories that flood the chat are hillarious - justice indeed - need more of that.
I love the flight, the gliders and having passengers on your mounts which certainly helps when travelling around the map with friends.

Class builds are somewhat unique, having 3 skillsets, I'm not sure what to make of this yet, as the characters seem super weak, but that would be due to the low level items I'm still forced to use, because... *dun dun dun* Labour points. Which does make the game seem somewhat more grindy than I'm presuming it is meant to be.

This game does have potential, don't ruin it like your other games Trion.
This review is subject to change, as and if/when, patches come out that fix the appalling state of the *dun dun dun* Labour system.

Edit;
Had this game refunded and removed from Steam.
My account was one of those banned as a safeguard when they got hacked and leaked their account database all over the place, after over a week of fighting their monkey support system who repeatedly failed to actually read my tickets and offered generic copy/paste replies (which tbh I don't mind, if they READ the ticket I put in) they could not unban my account, IP banned me accidently, failed to remove the IP ban, repeatedly. Absolutely appalling, will never purchase or play another Trion game again.

Do I recommend? Of course not.

reviewText: I’m not going to say the game’s bad, because it’s not… Even though the game’s immersive and crafting is incredible, the micromanagement aspect of the game just bores me to death (buy seeds, plant, water, wait x time, collect it timely or crops die, and repeat…).  I’m not into Farmville and this game feels like one merged into a tabbed MMORPG.  If some things were more automated and didn’t take such a ridiculous amount of time to get them done, then I’d probably have a different opinion.  Fight is fun and graphics are decent (though some of the textures don’t look too good…), but it’s just not for me.  If you dislike micromanaging, you’ll probably feel like I do.  I already have a job and plenty of responsibilities; I need to play a game that will feel like a hobby and not additional chores or work.  The game’s still in Alpha and maybe they will automate things a bit… Keeping my fingers crossed.

reviewText:
A very decent game, that is absolutely wrecked by its system of limitting the amount of activity that you can perform.

Around an hour after you start the game, you run out of your allotted labor-points, and then have to literally do nothing for half an hour or so before you can chop down a tree, or loot a mob, or craft an item, or anything really. You choose one of those activities to do, and then have to wait around again for another half-hour or so, then perform another activity. Just a terrible, terrible labor-system.

Some people will argue that you can just stay logged in 24-hours a day to build up the labor-resource... or just pay for the monthly subscription which gets you more of this activity-resource. Both are inexcusable necessities for a game that is purposefully throttling gameplay to extort cash-shop purchases.

reviewText:
Archeage is the worst MMO ever released to the American gamer.   Trion has ruined their reputation by continually making disasterous decisions ruining any chance of saving this title.

AA is suppose to be a game based on PVP, but to effectively PVP you must spend thousands to even begin to compete with those who spent thousands.   The high end gear is vastly superior to the tiers below and provides far too great of an advantage.

The cost to obtain the high end gear is outrageous and completely based upon very low percentage randomness.  Whales buy the gear for thousands.  The rest are nothing more than fodder.   I've literally seen someone PVP in high end gear sit down in combat with several others beating on them with little impact.   The person will stand up and wipe the group solo.  All due to their vastly superior gear.

Archeage is a cash grab, brings out the worst community, and is a failure on all levels.

On a positive note, the graphics look good in outside environments.  The interior instances (dungeons) are repetitive and poorly designed graphically and content wise.

Avoid, not worth playing even if free.

I apologize in advance for the wall of text, so for starters:
TL;DR
The game has lots of potential, it is generally good (aside from quite a few design flaws) and can be lots of fun once you find a good guild or bunch of people to run with.
However, the developer (XLgames) seems to treat the NA/EU players as cash cows of sort, doing their best implementing as many features that will eventually make you spend money on the game or stay far behind those who did and generally have a bad time. Trion have horrible support, did their best to back-stab their founders and paying customers many times, and have horrible communication with the playerbase.
The community is beyond toxic at this stage, and the game is slowly emptying of people (getting back on steam was probably another step trying to revive it, but it is a matter of time before people will drop it here too).

If you want a game to just relax and play here and there without commitment, it can be fun and versatile. If you want something serious - invest time and money, have property and such... Archeage becomes a huge money/time drain, stressful, and is designed to draw you in and not let go (labor has limit, if you reach it you lose" labor

reviewText:
First of all, as you can tell by hours played, this game consumed my life...  Secondly, over half of my hours played are spent AFK due to the stupid Labor regeneration.

I stumbled across this game last summer, and thought my wife would love it.  I wasn't wrong.  But what surprised me is how much I found that *I* loved this game.  From the time I started playing during the closed beta/Alpha stages, I was spending a large portion of my weekends living in ArcheAge.  It quickly became all-time favorite game.

The game itself is amazing.  Never before have I played a game where you can do just about anything.  Make a farm, grow what you need.  Use those materials to create ships, potions, food, houses, trade goods, etc.  Spend time tending to you home/garden/farm, take trade packs across the maps for gold, go deep sea fishing, steal other people's trade packs and or fish, PvE world bosses, Dungeons, PvP arenas, pirating... There is literally so much to do, that it is overwhelming.

Where all of these negative reviews are coming from, is from an administrative perspective, and that IS this game's single biggest failing, and it is  major one.  Trion has made mistake after mistake, seemingly on a monthly basis like clockwork.  These mistakes usually revolve around the Marketplace" (Cash Shop) and involve them placing very rare (and coveted) items in Mystery (RNG) boxes
date: where people pay real money for random items.  The game is based on an in game economy

reviewText:
Archeage is a very well made game, but made terrible by its publishers and executives.
7.4/10
Archeage has quests that welcome new players, but as an MMO Remember this game has ALOT of grinding to get a high level and most of this is questing. If you are interested in buying this game, don't- unless you have an endless money supply to keep up with the paying members.

THIS GAME IS NOT FOR FREE TO PLAYERS! I cannot stress this enough. I have tried *alot* as a free to play(couple hundred hours) some of it was fun, but it has been made worse as a game since it was in Alpha and beta since the release of Pay to Win items.

Pay to win items in Archeage are everywhere, sure you can buy cosmetics, but if you do you probably have bought many pay to win items in this game. To get the best gear in the game one has to regrade. Regrading makes the game more P2W than most because the chances of upgrading items become almost impossible (Highest tier regrade chance 2%- auto breaks if you fail the regrade).

As a game if there was no publisher involved-

Graphics: Archeage has not come a far way from Alpha, but I have not expected it too. The quality of the Terrain is sometimes a bit plain but there are objects of beauty everywhere in sight (trees, bushes and rocks fit in perfectly) and the game does not need to be run in high quality to be good.

Customisation: So far as menu options, with a quick ask in chat someone will tell me how to see quests 1000m away so I can see which quests I have not completed. The Hud is all resizable and you can move it around by shift-click(Dragging). There can be up to 5 hotbars, you probably don't need more :). Costumes as I explained before are mostly obtained from the Cash store and they look fairly well on other players. If you don't like realisim you might not like this feature but you can wear an entire set of armor under a dress or under a prisoners outfit.

Gameplay: Do quests, do trade runs (and sometimes get killed), do dungeons with mentors who help you and guide you :D, then do world boss raids where 50 people all pull out harpoons and go all ghost busters on the enemy npcs. Get a house (If you are patron) and grow stuff on farms( if you are patron). Overall you can do everything as free to play like playin enough to buy apex to get patron, and there is more free roam and ship sailing than any other mmo out there this good.

Graphics: 9/10 {Best MMO Quality objects, sometimes things did not load in for several people and had to relog}
Customisation: 7/10 {There are ship designs and costumes but costumes are hard to obtain as a F2P}
Gameplay: 8.5/10 {Lots of freedom to do what you want but getting into level 50 is a grinding spree with no real reward}
Publisher: 5/10 {The Publisher kept the cash store P2W aspect, does not have consistent Cheat protection}

Overall: 7.3

Note: This game was great in Alpha, if you have a time travel machine go back there to experience this at its height.
voteText: 29 of 38 people (76%) found this review helpful 1 person found this review funny

reviewText:
I put quite a bit of time into this game when it was released out of Beta and wish so badly I could recommend it but there are so very fundamental flaws.
I went into the game playing for free but quickly realized you can't do any real farming without a paid subscription.
The game has a tutorial for farming and a TON of quest for it too but you can't actually own your own farm unless you are a subscriber so your option is to use the public farms which are greatly restricted with what you can actually plant and how long you can keep said plant there.The only other possible option to plant trees and big groups of plants is to place them on an unprotected place in the game (really anywhere) and someone will always steal it. Stealing isn't really punished because the game gives you the option to become a pirate so it's almost encouraged to kill/steal.
If you get caught doing so many crimes you'll eventually be put to trial and potentially sent to prison and when in prison you wont be allowed to play the game for a certain amount of time depending on the judge's decision.
As a player you can serve Jury Duty for someone who commits a crime against you but realistically it's futile because the person gets anywhere from 5-30 min max prison time. Ohh, and the have to pick up garbage for community service. -__-

Sooo, once you've realized it's nearly impossible to farm (which is why I wanted to play the game) you have to create trade packs to get any real money in game. Trade pack runs are tedious and any one whether in your faction or not can kill you for said pack.You'll spend 30 minutes running the trade pack and run the risk that if you can even get it to another shore someone more powerful can just kill you.
There can be SOME fun to this if you go in groups but it's still tedious and time consuming either way.

If you want a house you also have to be a paid subscriber to own a land plot and HOLY ♥♥♥♥, good luck finding any space for said house or farm plot.All the plots have been taken since Alpha/Beta. People scam the system by creating multiple accounts  and getting around loophole of one plot per character. Those same people will wait for a demolished plot from someone who hasn't plaid their house taxes ,yup you have to pay property tax.

I was VERY lucky to find an awesome maxed lvl character that helped me around lvl 30 and gave me a 10X10 farm plot.
I also was able to find a spot for a house when the property prices plummeted after a huge server crash that lasted for about three days.
None of this would have been possible if I wasn't a paid subscriber.

I will eventually try the game again being a free to play member and attempt to do none of the farming quest and see if the game is enjoyable at all that way.
If you can somehow see past all the things I've mentioned and still enjoy the game then more power to you, but keep in mind Archeage has touted and open world Sandbox game from the beginning and fails to offer any of that unless you pay your dues. I wouldn't be as upset if I had known this going in but it's just too much of a cash grab IMO.
I feel bad for the people who paid $100+ for the Alpha packages, keep away from this game if you like your wallet.

reviewText: Played it months ago, Trion did everything they could to kill an amazing game, promises of no pay to win and then 1 week before release they flood the beta with pay to win, floods of complaints on the forums and they fix one item and ignore the rest while releasing more and more pay to win after release while ignoring the pathetic drop rates of the most important resource to crafting equipment in the game that has far lower drop rate than other versions while also being in RNG cash shop boxes not in other versions to ♥♥♥♥ people off further. They had the number of people who bought the founder packs yet somehow managed to have 6+ hour queues on all servers during all 4 days of the head start, naturally it got worse when the free players arrived. Right before I quit they added the most pay to win thing yet, a high chance to get the most valuable resource in the game that fueled open world farming, Archeum trees. They never even cared about the obvious gold farmer botting problems, you and 4 other people waste your resource that is used for nearly every action of the game that regenerates slowly to report 1 of the 30 bots in the same area and then see them still grinding in the same place a week later. They also ruined all the player made best in slot non equipment gear too, the best gliders made from 100 ultra rare items are now the exact same as the basic $$$ cash shop ones but have less useful abilities, the best mounts used to come from leveling up a mount and spending a ton of money to upgrade it and relevel it, now you just buy the cash shop ones that have better abilities since they all move the same speed, game is currently more pay to win than the other versions, don't know why people think otherwise. This is the 3rd time they have released a $$$ pack system, but I haven't actually checked in months so there could be more. Can't forget the purposely delayed updates, they had all the stuff released in the newest content update months before release ready in the alpha and took nearly 2 months to release 25% of the cut content after launch. Do not play this game as long as Trion has a hold of it.

reviewText:
Please note: I was a founder in the alpha and have put significant time into this game.

I played during alpha and loved it, it was such a fresh take on an old theme. But then during the later closed betas I could hardly ever get it to open. The reason is I have Avast as my antivirus software and Archeage's anticheat system Ahn Labs cannot deal with that. No matter what I do, how many tickets I submit, how extensive the results I get back, how many results I get back, all the suggestions on all sorts of forums, even trying to turn off my firewall, NOTHING works. It never works. It's not like I'm going to stop using Avast since IMO it's the best out there. So even though Archeage was a truly good and fun experience I can't play it and from what I read many people who have Avast experience the same issues.

I love this game and if you can play it and it actually can run on your system, do it. It is so worth it, the class system is extensive, the amount of crafting is great and provides an excellent alternative to combat. The trade runs are some of the most fun I've ever had in an MMO, they take time, planning, perfect execution, and a great guild. I loved everything about this game and if it were ever possible for me to play it again, I would in a heart beat. But for all of you who have Avast software let this be a warning, that the game might not work for you, and it might not EVER work.

reviewText:
I went into the game knowing I would have to sub, being that I've played MMOs since 1999, this didn't really bother me, to an extent. If you're going to market yourself as f2p but not allow all content for all, your product isn't f2p. Gimping players by not allowing all features of the game is sad. To add insult to injury, the monthly sub doesn't come with market credits (like all Daybreak Games/SOE online games).

The game ran fine at max settings on dx9 mode, after the 2 minute delay for Hackshield.

The questing was OK but nothing original.

The housing needed to be instanced. I know they wanted to be a 'sandbox' but considering you had to pay RL money to have housing (and use the auction house) on top of the fact land was limited, was sad. Other games like FFXI, FFXIV (to an extent), EQ2 and Rift have instanced housing zones without problems.

I really don't recommend the game unless you can look past those issues.

reviewText:
Pretty sad as this was the first MMO that I was attached to that I give it a poor review. I played roughly 8hrs a day from release after steam dropped it (CB2/3), so hundreds of hours are not logged on Steam. At any rate, the game was extremely fun to from the kickoff. You meet players around the world, quest, do dungeons, etc. The selling point for me was the mobility. Need to get somewhere quick? Warp or use your glider. I got lucky upon release and recieved patron status for free. That allowed me to auction and play the market, acquiring enough gold to buy APEX in game. Bought 4 months of patron for free that way, got some land, finished ingame questing. Then Trion decided to mess with the market, adding Pay 2 Win methods. I pulled out my wallet and stopped myself before making a poor judgement call in sinking real cash into the game. Here is why:

Land was sparse
RNG dictates so much in this game and coerses gambling habits (wih real cash before you know it)
Cheaters/Bots
Much more, play 50+hrs and you will see

Its free to play, but you will never catch up unless your wallet is bigger than your eyes.

reviewText:
I've played QueueAge since launch for about 4 months.

This game was definitely fun for a short while and had a lot of potential. Unfortunately they totally ♥♥♥♥ed up. From the beginning I was really skeptical with their founder bs, luckily I only paid $50 which I somewhat enjoyed during my 4 months but there was definitely a lot of frustration. Only reason I paid was to play with friends, if it wasn't for them I wouldn't have bought founder.

The game is very unstable. New patches for this game when I was playing somehow made the graphics options really weird. At launch I was able to play at high, then a patch came and I had to go on low or my fps would just take a huge dump. Then a new patch came out and it became unplayable on low and I had to switch to very high to be able to play. They released the North continent with castle sieges and we only had 1 week of castle sieges before something messed up and it had to be canceled for about 3 weeks. The server would sometimes crash when we killed the Kraken and we would have to wait up to a few hours until it was back up.

There are a lot of hackers and gold farmers in this game. The economy is pretty bad and finding land is somewhat impossible with the land hackers and all the people who were there first. The best gear is obtained through crafting and you would have to pray to baby RNGesus. Buying good gear was super overpriced for most people who didn't buy gold. This game was a mess when I left and I doubt it got much better.


I personally can't recommend this game. It's a free install/uninstall but if you don't want to waste your time. Don't do it.

reviewText:
I played the game in Beta.  It seemed like a great game...  until about 2 weeks after release, when I learned just how screwed up it was.  It is almost a lesson in feudalism, in which a small number of land owners, most of whom used hacks and exploits get their land, control everything, and you have spend a LOT of real money to buy in to the aristocracy.

Think of it as Eve: Online in which all starsystems, indlucing nullsec, were given to the first people to claim them after launch, and where there is no way to evict tenants, even those who got their land via exploits or RMT, and the only way to gain a system and it's assiated wealth was to buy it with cold hard cash.

It is such a horrible PtW model that it would not surpise me if the South Korean developers were getting kickbacks from online gold sellers.

I don't blame Trion, they don't have control of this game, they are just the publishers / distributors, and they probably didn't believe how bad it would be any more than I did.

Do not spend money on this game!
voteText: 19 of 26 people (73%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Hey Everyone,

Well I would like to say that is game is amazing, but it's not. I'm going to start with the good, and then list the bad and the ugly parts of this game.
The good parts of this game that they nailed on the spot.
1.character customization
2. leveling while in combat and crafting
3. the combat and skill customization to make your character unique to others
4. Mounts system.
5. the quest system is good.
6. Great tutorial
Unfortunately I only got to lvl 15, tried to get back on the next day, and the game could not load on computer. There are still a lot of things on this game that I have yet to explore or to experience and I would have enjoyed trying them out, but that leads us to the bad and ugly side of this game.
The bad parts of this game that throws this game in the garbage can.
1. Im going to start with the labor system. To give a general idea of how the labor system works is anytheing that you gather or create such as mining, gathering herbs, or maintaining livestock takes labor points. When you start off in the game you get zero labor points, and as a free to play subscription you only get 5 points every 5 minutes you play and none when not playing, which makes sense cause Trion wants to make money on subscription fees, which does give you more labor points to work with.
2. Crafting system. Sor far with the sandbox games Ive been seeing a lot of issues, and one of them is getting enough random matts (material that you get at random from opening bags droped from mobs.) So far I've came close to creating a sword but the the random matts stopped me in my tracks, which is depressing cause in ♥♥♥♥♥♥mes crafting is essential and without crafting makes the game lose depth and interest. But it still has potential as long as you want to put your spare time in this game(mostly all your spare time) to just make a sword aor anyother item that you want to make.
3.Main quests the good part about the main quests it gives you a decent story throughout the game, but when I do the maain quests the tend to get stuck on the beginning of cinima part and the game crashes. It's a great idea, but it reality they messed it up cause the game to freeze in black screen.

Now the ugly parts of this game.
1. This game is not computer friendly because you may be able to play this game at least 4 times before something goes wrong, and it doesn't load. Pretty much your waiting for this game to load or waiting for this game to crash. Most likely your waiting for this game to crash. When it does there is a internet page that pops up saying what YOU need to do to make this game work on your computer. The page is somewhat helpful but it didn't fix my problem with this game. ANYTIME and I mean ANYTIME a game that can't play on your computer and the the company tells you how to fix it, and they don't fix it themselves is a terrible game design in progamming, and the company who is in charge is not getting my money to play this game.
2. This game is definatly a pay to win game for sure, cause you cannot craft hardly anything at all with a free subcription.
This my review of Archeage, it had potential but they threw it down the garbage disposal of dispare, misery, and disapointment. I would highly recommed staying away from this game.

reviewText:
I rarely give negative reviews to games but this one I feel obligated to warn away as many unsuspecting players as possible.  It's not just me, either.  I bought a copy of this for a friend and started the game with a happy bubbling guild of 50 people.  Sure, we had fun during the first few weeks despite the 900+ person queues.  What MMO ever launches without a few hitches, right?

A few months later, guild dissolved as nearly everyone quit, most people gone due to rage and disappointment with the game's mismanagement. It turns out the client is fundamentally flawed to such a degree that hackers and exploiters could do everything from claim valuable real estate from afar to duplicate some of the most valuable and necessary items in the game. Never in all the years I have played MMOs have I seen so many bots - herds of them running rampant.   As if that was not bad enough, Trion introduced items into the cash shop that undermined cornerstones of the economy.  Now add in a very toxic and angry community where trolling is not only tolerated but encouraged...

I could go on, but that's just the tip of the crapberg.  I offer this review as a public service - don't waste your time or money on this one.  There are hundreds of games more worthy of it.

reviewText:
It may seem like I never cut the surface of this game just based on the amount of time I played on it on Steam. I have played about 500 hours on the Glyph app that the game was originally on (platform-wise). There are multiple gripes I have witht his game that kinda made me regret spending those hours playing on it.

Pro's
-The Graphics are sub-par however I have can play the game on high settings and the game looks pretty decent. I have however got curious to look at how the graphics are on Medium-Low, etc.
-Lore-wise there is some story even though that it is buried underneath a lot of cloud smoke and specific items that have a flavor text to them to understand some background information.
-Gameplay is somewhat engaging, in massive raid's to see a lot of things happening and brought some form of nostalgic feeling back in the day when I played Classic WoW.

Con's
-The overall atmorsphere of the game doesn't feel right, of course at the beginning of launch the game was full of pvp'ers, griefers, hackers, scammers, etc. And also that those who bought founders pack especially those who spent $100 dollars on the founders pack and got that game breaking boost that gave those who had it to get a lot more done and those who didn't fell behind really quickly.
-Questing in AA is a ♥♥♥♥♥ to do. You can't do anything without going halfway across the world just to find one thing only to go back to where you came from and have to go to the opposite way you just came from to complete the quest. The rewards from the main quest line aren't useful as you could find Dungeon gear that blows it out of the water, Even when you begin.
-Queue-Simulator, This was something that was a big issue in the beginning, So I am not sure how it is now, maybe there aren't that many people who play the game. But again this was another thing that really bothered me. Of course if you spent money on Founder's you would bypass that entire process.
-Balancing is a serious issue in the game as some classes are extremely useless while some are absolutely broken in all manners.
-Pay to Play (or do anything without a ♥♥♥♥ing limit). As with all Trion World games you have the option to become a patron" I call it founder even though I know the difference between the two. "Patron Status" is the good ol' thank you for spending money on us
date: here have everything on a silver platter and do not worry about getting behind because we will break the game for you. I honestly think the Patron is the equivalent to being a hacker. Say it takes 10 Labor to mine a vein of ore
recommended: and you have a base of 1000 Labor. Your could mine 100 veins of ore if you arent a patron. On the other hand you could become a Patron and mine 200 plus get bonuses along side it.\n-There aren't many other things you can do
hoursPlayed: unless you want to whip out your credit card to have an advantage over the other people. However that would make you a ♥♥♥♥ and you also wouldnt enjoy the game anymore if you hadnt liked it before."

reviewText:
I loved this game when it launched. Then the cash shop took over and made it pay to win to the extreme. Well technically it's pay to advance but in pvp if you aren't within a tier of other players gear you will get smoked every time unless you run with zergs or only spec the most op specs you can find to balance out your crap gear.

The game was beautiful and brought in ships to the MMO world, the ocean was gorgeous and from say 1 I just wanted a cottage on the ocean.....yaaaaaahhhhh right. The land grab crap was insane and stupid, people allowed to just buy up everything they could get their hands on. 99% of all houses that go defunct and come up for auction are won by flat out hackers and everyone in the game knows it complains and the devs do jack and squat over it.

To be able to compete gear wise you need to be willing to A: spend 500 dollars or more on the cash shop to get +chance combine items, or be willling to own upwards of 6 or 8 properties and have literally no life hauling packs all day long. You will then have a literal part to full time job with upkeep on your properties, and because items past tier 3 can drop enchants on fail or even break. Past tier 4 they pretty much break if you fail a combine which mind you only has like  a 10% chance to succeed. Prepare to spend most of your time breaking upwards f 30 pieces of gear to get one piece that allows you to fight against only a few people. The top pvpers will literally have most of their items 3 to 4 tiers above you and splat any 3 to 4 person group of average geared joes.

Also prepare to meet people who park carts that you can't bypass or move to block you from doing the 13 million trade pack runs that you need to do to even get in the door of pvp and there is no recourse. You can't kill them and they just sit there afk watching a movie and talking s-h-i-t.

I truly loved this game but even with my relaxed schedule I just don't have time to spend 20 hours a day on it.

If you plan to never sail outside of your safe zones, never pvp and pay some real money to buy land off the hackers who in turn sell the currency on their websites then you will love the game. Otherwise prepare to grind like you never have before. I am a long standing veteran of korean grind mmo's this one takes the cake. I have also played EQ since it's release and most every pvp oriented mmo out. The devs in this game are by far the worst pieces of horsec a c a ever. To be fair if you are in a good guild you have a chance to do freedich runs via zergs but otherwise gluck...

reviewText:
Hello,

I decided to play this for 1 month straight, as you can see i have over 500 hours. In a little over a month.

The biggest complaint I have with this game is that the gear progression is entirely randomized, and it is not randomized in your favor. They make money off people buying the boxes that contain the materials to upgrade your gear, and upgrading your gear through the method of the items is the only way to progress.

You can buy them with in game gold, but thats not the point.

The point is that the odds, even at basic levels? START at a 50/50 chance to upgrade your armor. From there it goes down lower and lower, with an increasing chance to even go BACK DOWN to where you started.

This isnt a fun gear progression, this is a marketing scam.

I spent most of my time in the later days of Archeage sitting in front of an auction house screen with three accounts going on at the same time, and this is to make money to overcome the random progression roadblocks with as many attempts as possible. And thats what they want.

I just quit archeage today, and I feel horribly sad that I wasted a month of my life on this money making scheme.

Thanks

reviewText:
If you enjoy a deep economy, crafting system, tons of content, and a great community, play ArcheAge. Not quite what you were looking for? Check out my TERA review and decide for yourself. Now on to the review.

Still here? Great. The rest of this review will be dedicated to the pros and cons of Archeage, and analyzing how it holds up in the oversaturated MMORPG genre.

Why ArcheAge is good:

-You are immediatly given a huge number of character customazation tools, making it easy to really personalize and come to love your in game sprite.

-Graphically beautiful. Everything from the in game models to the backgrounds and environments feel alive.

-Deep class system. Through the patented pick 3" class system and the option to change classes at any time
date: you should never feel bored or disappointed with your role.\n\n-Economy nuts will have a blast. Through a deep player driven market and well designed trading system
recommended: wealth is just a couple minutes away.\n\n-Deep and interesting universe. Each area feels aesthetically different and holds its own lore. About 60% of the quests
hoursPlayed: including side quests
voteText:
have some deeper meaning in the in game world and give you the opportunity to immerse yourself.

-Gear and loot tends to be pretty well balanced.

-Combat and pvp are intelligent. Mashing buttons isn't going to do you any favors. Play smart.

-The community is
helpfulPercent: generally speaking
votesHelpful: supportive and enthusiastic. Of course
votesTotal: it's up to you to find a guild and make friends
votesFunny:
but I doubt anyone would have trouble finding a friendly group to work with.

-Gaining skills feels rewarding. I genuinely looked forwards to each level up because it signified one step closer to something awesome (nothing feels as satisfying as your first meteor or tiger strike)

-The game really did feel like a sandbox. I never felt like I was being pushed one way or another. The story quests act as a sort of guided tour of each area
commentsCount: but other then that the game is more then welcome to let you do as you please.\n\n-Building
column16: owning
column17: and maintaining in game property is intuitive and immensly satisfying. From the smallest cottage
column18: to a mantion or castle
column19:
every home interior is fully customizable and ready to show off to your friends.

Why ArcheAge falls short of greatness:

I had a few major issues with ArcheAge
column20: but they mostly all boil down to two thing: Accessibility and Respect for the Player.\n\nSo what do these big words mean? Don't worry
column21: I'm here to help. Basically
column22: for much of the time I spent in ArcheAge
column23:
the game neither felt easy to use or even that fun at points. Here's why.

-ArcheAge is hard to understand.
Trying to craft or perform higher level trade runs (essential at higher levels) is a bit like trying to hit a pinata. If the pinata was the size of a penny. And your hands were tied behind your back. Basically I'm saying it's really not easy to do. There are a few vague and confusing extra curricular quests you can attempt to learn the most basic functions of these mechanics
column24:
but in the end you're still left confused and unsatisfied for most of the process.

-ArcheAge is hard to use without payment.
The so called "pay to win" model people often accuse Archeage of having is
column25: while exagerated
column26: somewhat factual. The game funtions on a "Labor" system
column27: where the player regenerates points while playing
column28: and then spends those points on in game actions. Come the later levels
column29: it is enfuriating to constantly find your self without Labor points. ArcheAge functions on a subscription basis
column30: but unlike other MMORPG's
column31: the subscription is less of a luxury and more of a necessity
column32:
as it doubles your maximum Labor and allows Labor regeneration while offline.

-ArcheAge does not respect your time.
ArcheAge has a deep dungeon system and great end game/pvp content. It's a shame you won't see a sign of any of this for the first 150 hours of play time at least. This game does a good job of rewarding players who stick around past the 250 or so hour mark. Not ready to dedicate that much of your time? Sorry
column33:
you're missing half of what the game has to offer.

-ArcheAge does not respect your desire for progression.
Grinding
column34: or playing repetative quests for the sake of progression
column35: is a staple for MMORPG's. This is understandable
column36: and can even be fun as a way to fill up your time between more important tasks or quests while leveling up your character. However
column37: in many places ArcheAge falls pray to excessive ammounts of padding and side questing that feels boring
column39: and generally leaves the player dissapointed at the game. I found it really saddening that
column40: although I was surrounded by beautiful environments and interesting lore

column46: laughing the whole time? It's moments like these that really left me smiling at the end of every play session.\n\nArcheAge is a good game. If you come to terms with its annoying and confusing segments

column49:
and socially enjoyable MMORPG's on the market.

7.5/10

reviewText:
You may think 5 hours playtime is too short to judge a MMO maybe it is, but i felt that's all the time i was willing to dedicate. I wont discuss the buisness model because frankly that is somthing each player must decide the value of.

In short the questing and combat feels like its about ten years out of date, it is dull hotkey mashing and pretty much nothing but fetch me ten bear ♥♥♥♥'s and or kill ten bears. Combat is also damned unforgiving if you want to fight more than one enemy at a time you'll probably die, i was playing as a tank character with healing abilities and at most i could fight two enemies at the same time anything more and death was certain.

I never bothered with any of the crafting systems after a short tutorial quest on farming i decided it wasnt for me. Essentialy you must buy seeds, pick a plot of land to plant them in then either wait for them to grow or water them to speed up the process, after all that you can then harvest but actualy gaining crops is not guarrenteed so it seems like a huge time sink. As a side note some crops takes litteral hours to grow, i think wheat was listed at over two and half hours for a single crop.

Gaining any resource in the world such as iron ore requires what the game refers to as labor points" essentialy this an arbitrarty point system that add's nothing but forces players to save up points thus missing out on items and loot
date: if you choose to save points eventualy you will be able to spend them on somthing good like a house but i have no idea how many hundreds of hours that would take
recommended: Points are generated all the time whilst logged on i believe you gain five points per five minuets of play
hoursPlayed: it is simply a bad system that punishes players for no reason.\n\nThis final point is probably the biggest nail in the coffin though

reviewText:
I want to recommend this game but its another game that just hasnt learned the lessons that older MMO's have already learned. Questing and leveling is slow and a major bore. The combat, while it isnt all that clunky, definitely cannot be called smooth. Combat still requires you to use skill rotations. Movement feels weird. I cannot put my finger on it but it doesnt feel natural. I think this may be due to the character animation/size. Music was great at character creation but then drifts off into a less than desireable sound that reminded me of 90s game music for some reason.

This game has cool ideas, like being able to steal from other peoples crops, forests, animals, etc... when they try to hide their farms up on mountains or in valleys.

Also you can commit crimes and leave behind clues that other people can report which will force you to go to jail and have to hold a trial by jury which is literally other players.

Lots of neat ideas but the game itself is shabby and does not feel smooth or fun at all.

reviewText:
While I will say that I've had a bit of fun with the farming in this game and I love all of the combinations of classes, the biggest problem with it is the housing. If you've only just started playing it, it will take forever to get your house/farm. First, if you don't want to pay the $15 for Patron, you can get the gold in game to buy the APEX tokens that will give you credits when used. However, the price is constantly fluctuating because of the other uses for credits in the marketplace. Once you've actually managed to work around the fact that you cannot have a farm and get the 600+ gold that you need to buy 2 APEX, you will then have to search for a place for your 8x8 garden. That may seem all fine and dandy until you realize that there's no place anywhere to place a farm, let alone one of the houses that require bigger plots of land.

Landgrabbing is probably the biggest issue in this game. You can buy them from other players, but it's usually for way more than they cost. The majority of the time, these other players are not even using the land that they own.

If you have a lot of time, this could potentially become a nice game for you. But play at your own risk.

reviewText:
Lets start by telling that ArcheAge actually is a good game. It's just this Free2Play version of the game that makes it bad. More over because the game is still running in Korea as subscription game, and then you can enjoy the game to it's fullest...

But enough of that, Why I think ArcheAge is a bad Free2Play game. Basically to enjoy the game to it's fullest you *MUST* become a patron (subscribe) for 2500 credits (cash shop currency) a month. To make things worse, you can buy them only per 1250 for a stunning €10. This means that the game would cost you a stunning €20 per month! A good thing though that you can buy these 1200 credit packs in game (much like EVE's PLEX) for around 650 gold (which would imply a HUGE grind for money!).

Why is it so important to be a subscriber? Easy, being a subscriber you get 2 benefits over a 'free player'.
1. You'll regenerate labour points while off-line, which a 'free player' does not and when on-line your labour point regeneration is twice that of a 'free player'. And labor being almost the most important thing in the game with a cap of 2000 points, it's a *MUST* to have a lot of it. Opening lootbags that contain gold costs you labour, mining ores costs you labour, cutting wood costs you labour. Basically almost every thing you do in the game costs you labour and as 'fre eplayer' you just don't have enough (you can always buy over expensive potions for labour points, but then I think subscribing is cheaper...)
2. As subscribed player you can own land, which is needed to grow crop and trees, in turn which is needed to trade. And trade is one of the key features of the game. With trading you make gold or 'gilda stars'. Both are important, but the gilda stars are required for the real special items, and as 'free player' you'll only get about 200 maximum through regular playing and questing. Okay, honestly speaking, you can grow a bit of stuff as 'free player', but chances are very small you'd find a space on those spots...

I have played ArcheAge during it's alpha and beta and I loved it because I had all the benefits of being a subscribed player. Now that I have returned, I can buy up to 4 months of subscription from the alpha pachage I bought, but the game doesn't feel the same anymore because of the restrictions. It actually feels very Pay2Win when you're a subscriber,  because of all the benefits you'll gain and honestly I doubt it's even possible to play and grind so much to get an equal benefit as 'free player'...

reviewText:
I've played since one of the early betas.
When it works, it's good.
However, it very rarely works.

Troublesome server and connectivity issues that Trion refuse to take responsibility for, a rather pay-to-win structure in the item shop, dodgy graphics issues and a dx11 mode that simply doesn't work on many machines get in the way of a surprisingly deep and enjoyable free to play sandbox MMO.


PROS:
-Good graphics, beautiful world
-Amazing social aspects
-Farming is fun
-Combat is solid
-Class system is unique
-Great music
-Questing is fun

CONS:
-Settings reset themselves on next launch sometimes
-dx11 doesn't work
-Horrible connectivity
-Graphical pop in issues
-Story is often shallow
-Pay to win
-Item shop overhauls have messed with in-game economy on more than one occasion
-Most of the game is effectively behind a paywall, or requires more time than the average player has to do for free
-Straight up broken a lot of the time

tl;dr, ArcheAge is a good game reigned in by a money hungry publisher who doesn't care enough about supporting the product, and in other hands it might have been an astoundingly refreshing addition to the MMO Genre as a whole.

reviewText: Don't let my time played fool you; I was playing this game before it was introduced to Steam. If you don't believe me, go ahead and check my two or three Archeage screenshots. This is why I felt I needed to suck it up, download it one last time and share with you my experience with this game. I will admit it is a beautiful game with an interesting battle system, a highly customizable class system and a justice system that I feel should be explored in other games. It also has boats, gliders, personal housing, trading, farming, etc. So why wouldn't someone want to play this game? For those of you who don't like to read, think of this game as Farmville, mixed with Candy Crush with a generic MMO skin. You want to own land? You need to buy the premium membership (15 dollars a month) and even then, good luck trying to get some with all of it bought up by other players or owned by hackers. Want to pvp? Have fun zerging, which is excusable I admit. Want to upgrade your equipment? Better hope that it doesn't randomly break. Sorry, but just like SWOTR, if you are going to put out a F2P" game
date: make sure you give access to all of the features to everyone without putting them behind a paywall. I do not recommend this game to anyone until they either go to a pure subscription model
recommended: buy to play or free to play with a cash shop sans buy to win."

reviewText:
BE WARNED! TRION WORLDS HAS TRAPS, TRICKS, AND TRIALS TO DEVOUR THE DEPTHS OF YOUR WALLET ON THEIR GAMES!

This review is by a player who has been playing Trion worlds games for almost 4 years, and has played them all. I currently run a game blog, and have been an avid supporter of Trion, and was even considering buying a share in Trion stock at one time as a major personal investment. I have even done beta for petroglph's and Trion's now defunt war of nations. Also Warface was ( not anymore ) slated to be released by Trion at some point.

Arche Age is infamous. From the obscene queues at launch, to the screwing over the founders, ripping off it's player base, memes, ( like the infamous comparing it to Sword Art Online, except you cannot log back in once out, to the meme of a skeleton sitting in from of the computer when it just let him into the game. I reposted those two many times, and I think Arche Age had a certain familiarity with the wait time to get online from the show Futurerama. ) to huge amounts of land being taken by botters robbing patrons of housing space, to now the evolution servers coming online. Evolution servers are formed by taking 6 servers ( yes 6 servers ) and merging them. Everyone on those 6 servers lost their homes. If on one of the 5 servers moving, you will need to rename your character if someone on the 6th server has that name. ( standard Trion worlds server merger policy. I have had to deal with it more then once. )

I have been with Arche Age since beta, and once it was done, played a little after. Then no more. I downloaded Arche Age just to put out this review. My time with the game above will reflect that. My friend suffered from not being able to play the game due to a green shield like splash screen and just quit. When it came on steam, she returned. She told me her land was dead. It went from seeing lots of people on beta, and after beta, to no one around. No one on her guild. She also never paid for patron, which allows you access housing. Yes. You have to pay real money to get a house. Then pay a weekly tax on top of that with in game currency. I have no idea about currently but that was at launch. If you cannot believe me that housing was a hot item, believe me, it was. Outrage ensued many times, and was reported many times by gaming sites.

I was not a founder of the game, and the following accounts were posted publicly on Arche Age forums, and published in news articles.

There was a lot of outrage when the founders got screwed leading to a angry thread about getting a refund for founder status. They got screwed when Trion gave better items at launch then in the founder packs. Some were denied patron status at launch making them wait 10+ hours in queue like me. They also had no ability to join the great land grab for a house due to loss of patron. They lost out on a promised 10% discount in the in game store, and was refunded about 10% of what they spent in real money on premeuim currency. Not with cash. In game currency. reviewText:
Dont waste your time or money here.

I played Archeage during its betas all the way to the first couple months after its release. The game itself is amazing. The problem then was poor management and armies of hackers and bots that were allowed to roam the game freely.

It is the reason i had quit but recently i heard that hacks and bots were finally getting banned and punished so i thought i'd give AA another go. This is what i found.

-The game is dead
And i cant really explain how empty it truely is. If you were to compare it to the population it had the first few  months from its launch (excluding bots) the playerbase has probably dropped 80-90%. Trying to play the game as a new player means your going to be playing alone till you hit lvl 50 unless you joined AA with some friends. Low level dungeons are never run so if your a new player dont expect to be able to see their content. Furthermore the game is still declining in population, trion is soon doing a server merge because ppl keep leaving and servers are becoming too empty. Some of them are to the point where its rare to even see another person and this isnt even being exaggerated.

-Toxic Community
Communities always have toxic players, MOBA's have the worst, but with archeage almost the entire community is toxic. If you ask a question in chat you get bombarded with harrassment. Players will mock you for not knowing every single thing in this game and majority of the time will just troll you with false answers. There is a 1% chance that someone will actually give you the right answer.

-Griefing
All games have it, most games put limits on it. Archeage supports griefing and encourages it. Is this fine? It can be. But its strongly abused in this game. Lvl 50-55s will camp low lvl and low geared players for hours to prevent them from bein able to quest or lvl up once they hit 30. Guilds will steal trade packs if your trying to do trade routes and either destroy the packs or store them forever so that you can gain no profit. <The biggest issue with this is that a safegaurd was originally set up that gives the owner of the pack 20% profit if someone else turns it in. Players dont want new people to make money which is why they destroy the packs or store them forever.

-Green Pirate Guilds
Players are now abusing the faction system. They choose to make war against Nuians for example but instead of becoming a hostile pirate (where you fight everyone) or joining Harayans, they make Nuian characters. This prevents Nuians from being able to kill them and has too many issues to even go into detail with. I'll say this though, its basically an enemy player that is given immunity to everyon around him with the option to turn it off and kill you or grief you when ever they want

-Bots / Hackers
They are not as bad as launch but they still exist, and through the 3 weeks of me being back in this gamei have noticed them more often making me assume they are going to be everyone again. Biggest issue with this is they are controlling the trade market causing prices to inflate beyond any new players budget as well as some current players.


-Player gap
This game has a massive player gap between new players and veterans. I understand that there should be a gap but the one in AA is ridiculous. It will take hundreds of dollars or months of constant farming to be able to acquire gear that will allow you to even try and compete with everyone in pvp or farmville. The price on everything in the player market is based on the hoarded amount of gold veteran players have meaning new players will struggle to afford anything.


-Poor management
The game is still being handles like garbage, all the bugs that existed in cbt still exist, new bugs arise, nothing is getting done. Trion also is using what might be an illegal marketing tactic on its players by selling them items in the cash shop that are advertised as Item A B C, then few weeks later telling everyone sorry" we typo'd on the cash shop item it does not contain items A B or C but only item D. No refunds are given during these "accidents".

-Dangerous Bugs
Some of the bugs in AA are very harmful to your computer
date: one of them causes the game to create files repeadetly on your computer using up all your memory. I had multiple instances where in 10 minutes of gameply
recommended:
AA created 5-10k files on my computer which was something like 8-16GB of data.



In the end this game is not worth playing. The concept of it was amazing and the game looks beautiful. But the poor management by trion / xlgames on top of the wall preventing new players from being able to experience the game
hoursPlayed: as well as the non stop griefing and toxic community
voteText: ruins anything and everything that AA could have been.\n\n"

reviewText:
There are a few things wrong with this game but mainly the labor system is what ruined the whole experience for me. I don't know if anyone else had specifically emphasized how bad of a (semi-)loot system this is, it doesn't feel like you’re earning anything. Basically if you want to get anything or do anything in this game regardless of…anything you have to use labor, it limits how much stuff you can get on a given day. This is dumb because labor recharges at a fairly slow rate and the only way to speed this up is to buy labor potions with either gold (which kind of defeats the financial purpose) or with real money. The combat is decent but I can’t pvp because my armour is ♥♥♥♥, so half the time I’m either letting my character auto smack a scarecrow all day or just playing a different video game while my labor fills up because that’s what I want to do in Archage….play another video game.


Edit: I wanted to post this review 2 months sooner but it wasn't on the steam page for some reason, even though I got this game through steam. Also it doesn't show how much hours I put into this game, but I have been playing this game since beta and its launch day.

reviewText:
First thing to say is this game has some solid ideas for the MMO genre such as the in depth crafting system, ownable land (have to pay a subscription) and naval combat but it is overshadowed by systems that are designed to force the player into paying money to be competitive in pvp.

One system is labor which is a very slow regenerating resource that is used for everything from crafting to gathering to opening coinpurses, yes monsters don't drop gold, they drop coinpurses that require labor to open.  If you run out of labor it is extremely limiting in what you can do but guess what.  If you pay a monthly subscription you can regenerate more labor offline and online and you can even buy labor potions with real life money...that alone is pay to win.

In addition to labor being an unnecessary annoyance the best gear in the game is crafted.  And there is another component to getting the best gear that requires luck in gambling or as people like to call it RNG".  This comes into play in the regrading and socketing systems.  You use a regrade scroll to try to get from say celestial to divine in weapon or armor that jumps the gear's stats.  One thing to note is at the higher tiers gear can break at a regrade attempt!  These chances are extremely low at the higher tiers and people will generally get charms that can increase your chances.  Someone ends up having to pay real life money (p2w) to bring these charms into the economy.  There is also luck involved in socketing gems into gear and anything after 1 gem has a chance of breaking all the gems in that gear.  Does this sound like fun to you?  Didn't think so

You can have someone come into this game with literally no playtime and buy their way to the top by buying APEX
date: selling for gold and buying the best gear in the game since the best gear is craftable.  If this isn't pay to win I don't know what is.  This is a perfect example of overly greedy companies destroying good ideas and it is a trend that seems to be prevalent in many mmos as of late (I'm looking at you ESO).  And the only people who defend this are the ones who spend an ungodly amount of money on the game and don't want to feel like a sucker (buyer's remorse) or apologists for a company that doesn't care about them.  It's people like these that reward shady business practices and they are a blight on the gaming community.  Well
recommended: I think the gaming community deserves better.  The second a sandbox MMO with equal graphics and some of the better ideas of Archeage comes out without soul sucking systems such as labor or RNG in crafting Archeage will die.  ♥♥♥♥ this game\n\n"

reviewText:
Here’s a game that could have been good...

ArcheAge isn't anything too over the top in innovation, in fact it looks like everything from the combat system to the crafting systems was taken from other games but it would be wrong to say XLGames didn't put alot of work in polishing.
The game looks nice and even has voice acting in it along with alot of CSs.

The problem here is the F2P model Trion has picked to fund their game. For people that like crafting I am sorry, you will have to buy something with real cash to really do any crafting. I wanted to check out the music feature but I'm not going to pay for something that I'll mostly never touch again.

I'm not a big fan of tab targeting nor games holding my hand and not making it challenging but I'm not basing my review on that. The reason I tried this game was for the music thing but I see now that is not going to happen without buying something.

Cash shops are fine but forcing your players to buy core game play is not. If you are going to do this then do a subscription model or guildwars it.

reviewText: Well, graphically this game is nice, which is pretty much the only postive thing i can say about in the almost 2 hours i played. My friend has been bugging me for weeks to try it, so to shut him up i did. I got about 3/4 into the tutorial and was like nope. I know my friend told m the tutorial was bad, but thats an understatement. After the first cutscene where you get to move aroud, my character started glitching out, doing some odd headbangs. and within a 5 min period it did again. Not a big deal tho. Then you get on a pirate ship, and i notice where the captians quaters would be, its missing textures and i can see right though the boat. Sloppy much? Then after a cannon battle, another cutscene and then your shipwreked. You then get to use these gliders, which i accidentally skipped over that part . Then you have to mount a siege on a castle your enemies are building. Now keep in mind this is all happening with 2-5 days, and the castle they have built is insanely massive. Makes alot of sense right? You have seige tanks even tho your shipwreked. You enter then retreat when the captian gets hit with an arrow. Then afer a cutscene you wake up and it was just a memory. The intro is what supposed to draw you in, but ArcheAge doesnt understand that it seems. Also the difference in graphics during the cut scenes and gameplay are quite noticeable. When playing the graphics drop in quality. Noone has prob read all this, but i think this game is far from done. I've played several games in Alpha that were more complete then this. I think this shouldnt have even been release, or atleast marked as Alpha or PreAlpha if there is such a thing. I do think this could be a great game, but it needs alot of work.

reviewText:
Pretty much there is everything that I hate about MMORPG's.

Pointless quests,
Mouse targeting ( instead of actual action combat ),
Uninventive combat and classes,
GRIND ( both EXP, Gold and Materials if you want housing or better weapons/ armors )
Microtransactions,
Skimpy bikinis and oversexualized women/men.
Bad controls ( if you are archer you have to keep pressing 2 to attack plus WASD to move, fingers hurt much? )

In other words you are forced to do mundane chores before you can play the way YOU the player wanted to play this game. Whether by hunting beasts and getting loot or by choosing peaceful approach and farm/build.

I don't know why this is even popular? I guess I don't dig it.

reviewText:
So eventually my friends tempted me into playing this with them.
How did they do it?
My friend said his character was an emo chick... a good character creator is really tempting.
So I went about making my own hot emo character and I was pleased with the results.
Things were looking good. Maybe this would be the first MMO I would enjoy.
My hope was quickly dashed as soon as I was given control of my character which was lacking in any animation. Eventually the game got its ♥♥♥♥ together and my character was alive. TANK CONTROLS! ♥♥♥♥ing tank controls! Mother F-
So the tutorial was long, painful and I was never really sure what exactly was happening. A bit like first time anal sex.
And like anal sex, it eventually came to a sudden stop. Once I was placed into the world, I noticed 2 half-naked people dancing with a passion greater than that of the acting of Leonardo DiCapri-Sun.
The 2 freaks began shuffling towards me. Dear God, the tutorial didn't prepare me for this. I was outnumbered and these seemed like the kind of guys who had watched Footloose way more than any doctor would recommend.
It was my friends... so naturally, I ran the ♥♥♥♥ away.
Well I'm bored of writing this review now just like how I got bored of this game, so I'm gonna give up on it just like I did this game.
Summary:
This game was fun for a dancing/molesting simulator but at the price it’s asking for, I expected more.
But then again, I don't know jack about MMO's so why the ♥♥♥♥ does it matter what I think.

reviewText:
I loved this game. So much. It had everything I wanted from an MMO in terms of content, beauty, uniqueness, and capability to run on a toaster at decent settings. Group content was exciting; the grind was length, but oh-so satisfying as nearing the top became more and more realistic. The style's great, combat is satisfying, builds can be varied and are flexibly experimental if you're okay with venturing outside of whatever's OP this season.

But when you crawl closer to the point where you know the real content is locked away, it becomes more and more apparent how P2W the game is, and it's heartbreaking. Everything from a content standpoint is varied attractive, fluid and functions for the most part as it should, and it's impressive as a whole. What's wrong with the game has to do with how Trion treats its playerbase, which is like complete and utter garbage. There's no reaction to actual in-game problems, there's no remedy from a gameplay standpoint, and from an end-game grinding standpoint that supports F2P players in even the slightest.

I'm not really going to say anything that hasn't already been said, but don't commit yourself to this game without being ready to shovel out a respectable amount of money-- probably more than you'd pay for an episodic series of any AAA title, when all's said and done.

Just don't. Trion won't change.
