reviewText: First of all. Though in the end i won't be giving the game an actual reccomendation. Yes, you should definetly appreciate what Archeage is trying to do. The story was interesting and the gameplay, while unintuitive at times, was fun. But here's where i get to the part where i explain why i'm not reccomending this game. Far far far too many reasons the game came up with to not allow me to play. First an error #104 that didn't allow me to finish updating until i had dove into the files and fenagled with the few things necessary for the fickle updater to not screech at me. Then launching the game. I get to the server selection screen, pick a server, start connecting, and crash to desktop. When you can't connect to the server you choose you get the message the gods hae disconnected you" along with a helpful note to maybe check your network connections and whatnot. After checking to make sure my internet was still functioning i tried again. I got into the game once in the maybe 35 times i launched the game. Kyrios was the server i ended up playing on
date: and after turning the visuals down to low entirely because it's either poorly optimised or too much is going on. Still having to deal with occasional lag spikes that froze me for up to 10 seconds. I got up to level 9 (confetti sound). Then the friend i was skyping at the time got off and i decided to take a break. So I tried to go back to the character selection screen. And crashed. Now i'm back to the launch crash rinse repeat cycle again. While i am going to attempt to keep playing
recommended: the fact that these issues have been largely unresolved for many people for roughly three months is a little daunting and discouraging. If you like what the game has to offer and can't find another game that does it

reviewText:
For a new and upcoming Mmorpg this feels very outdated the combat System is just crap no real time dodging or kiting.
The most annoying thing about combat is that the first person to hit a enemy gets the loot and the credit to the kill this kind of system should not even exist in current Mmo's.
This essentially feels like World Of Warcraft but Unlike Wow i dint get caught up in playing for hours on end. As soon as you create your character you are thrown into the world to do a bunch of pointless fetch quests or Kill 8 of these guys for example with no real direction of where to head or what to do its essentially follow the trail of quests so that you can be led to the next area to do more of the same.

I watched the trailers and reviews thinking Oh my god this Looks like it could be the next big mmo" But what the trailers and reviews showed i have yet to even see for if you wish to get to the great part of this game you must wave through all the crap and cliche mmo traditions that should of died out long ago.


Now this also claims to be F2p But come on really when we have to pay anywhere between 50$-150$ thats not really f2p sure this money is for beta access but even once the game comes out in full you will still have to pay a subscription to continue with the main features of the game such as house building or farming.

All in all if you want a true a f2p mmorpg just go buy guild wars 2
date:

reviewText:
This could have been an amazing game.  The concepts are nothing new except for a few things.

1. Owning land in a non instanced environment.  This would be great is there was land available that didn't cost an arm and a leg due to land value being highly over inflated due to the economy of the game.

2. 120 different character classes.  Yep there are 120 different character classes available but really only a few that work in game if you're planning on doing any sort of combat.  Some can be modified slightly but really the classes still end up being cookie cutter.

3. Any class can use any armor or weapon.  Haha just kidding you can but you can't.  It's very stat dependant and only certain gear really has the stats that you want as far as quest rewards and crafting until the lvl 50 sets that could potentially allow you to use whatever you wanted as whichever class you wanted to play.

4. Trade routes.  Fun for awhile but after the fun wears off the manotony sets in and it's about as fun as sitting in the prison.

5. Jurys and prison.  Okay this is something that I feel was actually done right.  You get to look at the crimes of whoever is on trial when you're on the jury and decide whether they're guilty or innocent and if guilty how much time they will served based on the amounts that they give you in the game based on the defendants crime points.

Final thoughts.  I wanted this game to be good.  I really did but in all actuallity playing it for about a month it got boring and repetative.  With the current land issues and marketplace/economy problems (at least I see them as problems, this game is very pay to win) I wouldn't recomend anyone playing or spending any money on this game in it's current state.

Things that can be done to turn Archeage around would be to stop allowing things purchased from the cash shop to be sold on the auction house.  Allow loyalty tokens to be used to purchase more if not everything from the cash shop.  STOP BEING SO GREEDY TRION.  If something is available in a game and you have a way to subscribe to said game then that subscriber should not be required to also spend extra money in your cash shop to advance in the game.

Once again it is my opinion but DO NOT SPEND MONEY ON THIS GAME IN IT'S CURRENT STATE!!!

reviewText: I spent a lot of time in this game during the beta testing and loved it.   It had an interesting beginning story, fantastic character creation, awesome crafting system, and the ability to build your own house in the world, for starters.  However, it changed upon official release.  I managed to get enough points together to buy a house, only to discover afterwards that I had to have an account first.  I loved the game enough to get the account, only to then discover that bots had taken up every bit of available land.   I spent hours of real time looking for a spot to place the house, only to never be able to do so.  And the crafting system, which is a major component of game play, requires the player to have land.  I finally became disheartened and gave up.  But I really loved this game and recently reinstalled it through Steam.  I logged in and found the streets deserted.  I travelled to the nearest housing settlement and found that it was still completely overrun by bots.  And to make matters worse, in the span of 45mins, the game crashed on me three times.  This could have been amazing, but Trion killed it.

reviewText:
This game has some major flaws that need to be addressed!

First flaw is one that keeps me from playing this game on Steam. I had to give up and just use the game manager through Trion's website. If you ask me this is probably on purpose so Trion does not have to share money with Steam. Very dishonest of them. I also had a similar issue on my laptop except that it would never play due to missing direct X and Cry engine files. The problem was that the Steam version did not install these files but the one from Trion's website did. How can this oversite have happened?

This game takes entirely way too long to load even when it is working, sometimes in upwards of 10 minutes. There are some serious optimization issues... And no it is certainly NOT due to my computer!

Shutting down the game disables your mouse and this has to be fixed by disconnecting it and then reconnecting it. This is very annoying but luckily for me I have a wired/wireless mouse so I do not have to crawl behind my computer every time.

After playing the game for extended periods of time the textures on various creatures and terrain in the game turn to crap and this can only be fixed by shutting down and restarting the game. This then brings you to the other 2 very annoying issue of fixing the mouse and then waiting forever  for the game to boot up again.

This game is effectively Pay to play/Pay to win due to the following mechanics:

I can not use the auction house with spending money of buying a license off of someone with an excessive amount of gold.

I can not open any of the loot dropped without spending Labor" which accumilates at a rate of 5 per 5 minutes only when logged online. Opening a green drop at level 20-30 costs 30 Labor. Labor is also used for almost everything you do in the game like crafting
hoursPlayed:
etc... and your Labor cap is 2000. If you pay the monthly fee then the Labor cap is 5000 and it generates at 10 per 5 minutes online or offline.

Storage breaks this game also. Storage is fine until around level 20. You have 50 slots in your bag and another 50 slots in your warehouse (bank). Expanding this becomes the problem. It costs 300 credits to expand it 10 slots which translates to $2 every expansion scroll. Expansion scrolls can be bought in the auction house but the going rate is around 75 gold which I have yet to accumulate at around level 27.

Crafting is very extensive and normally I would consider this a good thing but with the issues of "Labor" and storage it makes having to craft extremely annoying.

I can not recommend this game mainly due to the greedy descisions made by XLGames and Trion. This game has much potential but ALL of the above issues need to be fixed.

"

reviewText:
I have (off of Steam) over 2,000 hours on this game. I’ve played this game since closed alpha. I stopped playing from October 2014-September 2015 and just started again.

Almost all of the negative reviews of this game started as positive ones, but people got dissatisfied during the period I mentioned above for numerous reasons. Bots were rampant, but they have now been removed. The cash shop got out of control, so the developers decided to introduce other means for users to get these items and therefore restarted the economy. Classes became unbalanced with introductions of new weapons/armor, so the devs fixed that too. There WAS a period where this game got unplayable, but it was fixed. Sure, you can pay and get armor/weapons/whatever, but you can also craft it on your own if you actually put time into the game. I’m tired of hearing “pay to win” or whatever. Stop crying about it and stop getting angry at the people who are dropping hundreds of dollars to play a game. That’s their life.

This is BY FAR the best mmo that I have ever played, and believe me; I’ve played a lot of them. The PVP is amazing; the combat system is fluid, and the player base has evened out to the point where only fun, dedicated, and invested players remain. New players are being discouraged from “negative” reviews of people who haven’t played in forever.

reviewText: A lot of people in the review section for this game constantly complain about it being pay2play. HOWEVER, it is not pay2play. Almost everything if not everything in the game is obtainable without paying for anything. yes it is true that you will have a much larger grind if you do not may the small 10 or so bucks a month for patron status but you CAN however buy patron status IN game with in game currency. Honestly i don't know why people were surprised that the game was so grindy, most korean mmo's are. To be honest the game isn't for everyone but if you don't mind a bit of a grind and have a couple of friends to play with then I definitely recomend this game

reviewText:
Archeage.....


Where do I start
Well I think I will start from the beginning, Long ago in a time where game companies made games for fun and enjoyment Archeage was born. It orignated in a land known as Korea. Now Korea or XL games decided to make a truly openworld sandbox MMORPG. Their creation was truly brilliant. Trion Studios the creators of Rift, Defiance and Trove all good games decided to make a western port for us American/Australian/New Zealand/English Folk. I first heard about the game May 2014. The game had been out in Alpha for about a couple of weeks I believe. I saw the game on steam advertising founder packs for access to alpha/beta testing. I myselfn was curious as I saw it was being produced by Trion Studios and I am a big fan of Rift and have sunk a decent amount of time into it along with Defiance. So I decided to do some research on the game. I couln't believe how bad ♥♥♥♥ the game sounded, I don't know about you but sometimes when I read a book I like to just have a relaxing adventure not some heartstopping action all the time and have a break from the danger. Like when they are describing a picturesque scene somewhere I just like imagining relaxing/swimming through the rivers and what not. I don't know if this is weird but I love a book like that.

Anyway I heard about the amazing aspects Archeage had to show, first thing I learnt about was the trade runs. A trade run is where you gather certain materials and turn it into a pack that your chracter carries, this slows you into a walk. You then have to transport it from Point a to point b, the cool thing about this is the further that you take the pack the more gold you will recieve when you turn it into a gold trader. The gold gets mailed to you on a 22 hour time period I believe with 22% interest. So the game had this whole economy thing going that I just loved.

I began to watch youtube videos about this and night after night before going to sleep I would read up on the game and watch people play the alpha. I just knew this game was going to be special!

I then learnt about the naval aspects with sailing/pirating. Now I was about to have an ♥♥♥♥♥♥!! A massive open world no instanced areas! And you can sail between continents delivering goods to far off lands! This just sounded too good to be true. The water was a massive turn on for me! Have you seen how gorgeus the waters surface looks! Its good enough to make a grown man cry!

I was holding off on purchasing my way into the Alpha as it cost $150 USD and I was a little sceptical as I wasn't sure if it was worth that much money. However one evening I decided to make the purchase! I bought the game and sat down shoving my homework to one side. I eagerly sat awaiting it to install while browsing through beginner tutorials. I couldn't wait to get a farm set up and start my life as an honest samaritan before turning into a pirate at the max level and raiding un suspecting traders!

My first character was a Firran, He was a stone arrow I believe which is a mixture of Archery, Shadowplay and Defense. It was like a tanking rogue. I had alot of fun on that character believe me the adventures me and Severin shared were incredible. Alpha housed some of the most amazing gaming memories I have. Nothing even the atrocious piece of ♥♥♥♥ the game is today, we'll get to that, will change my love for the adventures that were had! I remember I had a lovely farm cottage set up on the hills overlooking the ocean with a massive mountain with lush forest for a backdrop. It was so peaceful logging in and greeting my neighbouring farmer who set up his house on a plot near me. I worked so hard and eventually I had enough materials to build a Galleon Ship. This is a massive warship with 8 cannons and a crows nest. I said goodbye to my guild as I was about to set off on the life of a pirate! I then began the process of stealing other peoples crops and trees. I also in war periods in certain zones began killing members of my own faction. As other people came across my wrong doings they would report me and slowly buy surely my crime points began to rise...

Eventually when I had done so much misdoings and commited enough cold blooded murders I was kicked out and exiled from my continent Halcyona. My friend and I set sail for Growlgate isle nervous but excited none the less for our new journey. I couldn't believe I had been playing the game for over a  month! It felt just yesterday I had started my journey in the Falcorth Plains! As the sunset and a mist gathered across the ocean we were cast into darkness. I was steering blindly as wave after wave pounded the bow of our ship. Salty air whipped my face as I clung to the wheel in desperation. My friend scoured the map to make sure we were on course!

A few moments later we were under attack from monsterous jellyfish! My mate swept out his sword and began to fight for his life while protecting me as I was vulnerable trying to keep the ship under control! I remember watching hopelessly as he fought valiantly. Eventually he drove them off and the wind changed. With a burst of speed with set off into the unknow.

The clouds began to part and we could see an island in the distance. My friend assured me that it was Growlgate. With butterflies in my stomach we set forth for a new life as a pirate.

As we docked into the port we could hear the bustling port packed with life. I looked up and saw a pirate tending his livestock. Long story short, much fun was had over teamspeak with our new guild as we raided and plundered the high seas! We even defeated the Kraken the worlds largest boss!

Do you get what I'm saying, the game in Alpha was fantastic! I remember the fateful day came when the Alpha servers were about to go down that night. Their was a massive party by all and every race got together and enjoyed their time together before our characters would be wiped from existence. There are some great screenshots of the last day of Alpha out there if you google them. I remember I was partying it up with my guild at mirage isle (the main shopping island). Then that time came round and I lost Severin...  I cried manly tears of course.

Beta testing arrived. I was kind of put off as I didn't want to lose another character again for launch. So I only leveled to about 26 and stopped awaiting launch on September 16th.

Launch Day...

If you were unfortunate enough to have experienced Launch day for yourself then you will know what I'm talking about. To cut a story short the Launch day was a disaster. Their were ques for hours just to log in and then when people got in they got disconnected. There were ques where people were 12,000 in line!!! And it said estimated time left 28 hours!!! This was unacceptable and Trion were not prepared for such large numbers wanting to play the game.

I myself was a patron at the time so I got priority and got in, in about 5 minutes.

As land was not instanced there was only so much land left. I was luck enough to get my self a 16x16 farm plot but in a couple of hours there was almost no land left. Many people were up in arms as they couldn't have their own farm as bots stole alot of it and were selling it off for real money.

I started a Nuian on the other continent called Starlix. He was a Hellweaver, which was a odd class to play I must say. It was a mixture of Battlerage,Sorcery and shadowplay. So basically a warrior mage rogue all in one.

I remember 16x16 wasn't enough space to grow crops so I had so much fun adventuring around the zones climbing up mountains that looke unclimable and gliding to far off pastures to plant as much crops as possible. A person I met once up n the hills was called Divinity she was so nice to me, Thanks Divinity <3 I have no more room left so long story short the game is crap its ptw. If you want good gear you need to buy RNG boxes. No endgame content either.

RIP Archeage you will be missed :(

reviewText:
My review was once positive.  That was during the alpha phase when I bought two Archeum founders packs.  Let me tell you something, I was a damn fool!  A damn naive fool.

The game started out pretty, decently fun, nice soothing sound and music,  to me, and granted I am old enough to have played games since they were text.  I have a myriad of games under my belt.  Ok, you get it, I was digging the game.

Trion screwed up the launch worse than any game I have ever seen.  Yes, I was there for WoW and all of its expansions launches.  Yes, I was there for Anarchy Online, DDO, so many games.  They totally failed to provide and live up to the promises they made their founders.  So much for bonus items at launch, for a headstart, etc...  You coud not even get into the game.  The queue times were 16+ hours.  And once people found that out they would not log out.  They would run circles afk.  Trion did not care.  ALL the land was gone in mere minutes.  Even land that was impossible to get to at launch.  Hackers were rampant and domiating.  Trion did  not care.

What Trion did care about was micro-transactions and that stuff was spot on.  They updated that stuff like crazy.  They cared not about the economy being blown by hackers and their massive failure to provide.  They just used that as fuel to sell micro-transactions.  Some conjecture that Trion allowed the issues to go on for that purpose, some even conjecture Trion was secretly funding the hackers or that they were workers from the Korean side.  I wouldn't doubt it to be honest.  Trion is some dirty ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s.  Once the economy started balancing out and people start getting rare items that the hackers were cashing in on.  Trions turns and ups the drops rates to like 90%, overnight items went from 2k gold to 80 gold.  The have nots that farmed their asses off to make a sell and some back were screwed.

Back to land, land was promised, land makes the game go round.  There was none.  They opened new servers and added a message on existing servers Want land?  Come to server xxxx"  Guess what?  Even if you wanted to abandon your progress and move servers to a new toon
date: there was no land.  Even though that message was up for weeks the land was gone in minutes.  It was a token effort to fight against refund and poor BBB reviews.\n\nCensorship.  NEVER have I seen forum moderators so heavy handed on censoring the truth.  If you spoke a tiny bit of negativity
hoursPlayed: you could and would be banned.  Especially on any really dirty practices in customer service.\n\nCustomer service was literally non-existant for 6-8 weeks
voteText: when they did hire more it was automated

So long in fact that when you asked for your entitled refund they told you that you were past time to get a refund even though it was their fault.  They even argued that through the BBB with MANY customers who posted their dealings on the forums.\n\nNow more than ever

reviewText: Alright so let's just say this game has all the aspects a good game would have. Movie-like cutscenes, different gameplay, and of course cute characters with a hint of anime/manga style to them. Here is what is really screwing this game over from being a very likeable one: The lag is unbelieveable, and so is the fact that the voice acting is late as well. reviewText: There was a time during Alpha and Beta where I would support this game but after playing the live version and dealing with the Trion Support staff, I have quit the game and will not be going back. The game has a few bugs which when encountered can make your experience not ideal... The first problem I encountered with Trion was during the process to buy APEX. I tried several times to buy them but their system wouldn't accept my MOP. Upon inquiring with the support staff, all they told me was it was a bug on their end and they've fixed it now on my account...  the second issue I had was that I was kicked me off their servers during an expensive trade run and for hours I couldnt get back in due to what seemed like poor stability of the servers. I was able to play other games, Youtube, browse the internet without any problems but Archeage would not allow me on. I ended up losing a considerable amount of progress and assets in game and all I got from Trion was please follow these steps to troubleshoot YOUR internet problems"... Both of these experiences left a bad taste in my mouth.\n\nIf you're planning to play for free and not spend anything- I recommend it... but if you do support the project with your real money... don't expect anything from Trion if something goes wrong and it seems like this game is littered with little bugs here and there so you're bound to encounter something that will give you a negative play experience at one point or another."

reviewText:
The game is great!
And I would recommend the game to anyone.

But the publisher, Trion Worlds is the worst publisher I have ever encountered with an MMO.

European laws state that you can request a refund within 14 days but wait.. Trion Worlds has a holy Policy that says they do not have to.

Also a small little change like unbinding a bought mount is too much work..
Why bound mounts to one character when it is bought is also beyond me.

Unfortunately you have to buy Patron to enjoy the game to its fullest so getting around Trion Worlds greedy policy is impossible.

So unless ArcheAge gets rid of what is killing it, Trion World I would not recommend this game.

reviewText:
The first three months of release was the most fun I have ever had in an mmorpg (my 1000 hours are only on Steam, I also have around 600 hours on the regular client).
Then everyone quit and now it's pretty much dead.

XLGames and Trion ♥♥♥♥ed us over with their P2WIN and ♥♥♥♥♥♥ decisions. Avoid this game and if you are ever thinking about returning, turn around and never look back.
We all love the Archeage concept of an pvp-centric sandpark but it will never be as good as it was in alpha (when there were no cash-shop) or at release (where most of us were equally geared).

reviewText:
This game was the best MMO I ever played.... when I first started. I've logged over 1,000 hours (before I downloaded on steam). The game is beautiful, flawless gameplay and was just fun. But the developers like all the others got greedy. I hate to say it, but please don't waste your time, I log in usually once a month just to say hey to good old friends but cant stand game anymore.

Pro's
-Beautiful game and graphics
-Great abilities and skill combinations
-Good PVP (unless playing p2w people)

Con's
-The game is P2W
-Every month Trion comes out with another box to give people more perks for more money
-If you dont pay you don't stand a chance in PVP
-Housing is horrible if you don't already play good luck getting property, its first come first serve, and its gone.
-Story line is very short and not that good

reviewText:
The game is great!
And I would recommend the game to anyone.

But the publisher, Trion Worlds is the worst publisher I have ever encountered with an MMO.

European laws state that you can request a refund within 14 days but wait.. Trion Worlds has a holy Policy that says they do not have to.

Also a small little change like unbinding a bought mount is too much work..
Why bound mounts to one character when it is bought is also beyond me.

Unfortunately you have to buy Patron to enjoy the game to its fullest so getting around Trion Worlds greedy policy is impossible.

So unless ArcheAge gets rid of what is killing it, Trion World I would not recommend this game.

reviewText:
This game was the best MMO I ever played.... when I first started. I've logged over 1,000 hours (before I downloaded on steam). The game is beautiful, flawless gameplay and was just fun. But the developers like all the others got greedy. I hate to say it, but please don't waste your time, I log in usually once a month just to say hey to good old friends but cant stand game anymore.

Pro's
-Beautiful game and graphics
-Great abilities and skill combinations
-Good PVP (unless playing p2w people)

Con's
-The game is P2W
-Every month Trion comes out with another box to give people more perks for more money
-If you dont pay you don't stand a chance in PVP
-Housing is horrible if you don't already play good luck getting property, its first come first serve, and its gone.
-Story line is very short and not that good
-Huge grind from 50-55 and not much fun
-Getting gear will take forever to craft the good stuff you want/need
-All skill require labor, you can only get like 2600 labor a day without potions (doesnt go that far)
-So many bots in game, and they take all the mining and such and trion still does nothing
-Many many more things, hope this helps

reviewText:
The first three months of release was the most fun I have ever had in an mmorpg (my 1000 hours are only on Steam, I also have around 600 hours on the regular client).
Then everyone quit and now it's pretty much dead.

XLGames and Trion ♥♥♥♥ed us over with their P2WIN and ♥♥♥♥♥♥ decisions. Avoid this game and if you are ever thinking about returning, turn around and never look back.
We all love the Archeage concept of an pvp-centric sandpark but it will never be as good as it was in alpha (when there were no cash-shop) or at release (where most of us were equally geared).

reviewText:
Good graphics and alright gameplay, that is until you find out that everything requires labour points.

Do you want to open a coin purse that contains the money loot from mobs? You know the thing that usually drops for free in 99% of other games? Don't worry! Use your hard earned labour points to get it today(because it really is quite hard to open those bags, i mean i frequently break a finger or two when i try)!

But that's not all! In this game you can identify equipment with hard earned labour points too, instead of in-game currency like in other games!

But that is still not all!!! Just in this game, free of charge, you can identify equipment from quests for labour points too... you know the things that should already be identified!

If you want to do worthwile crafting, planting, farming...etc.(you know 70% of the advertised mechanics), you need a subscription, just now for 15usd and as a bonus, we will also allow you to build stuff, you know because that isn't part of the base package.

But that isn't all at all, you find the number of the 2 character slots lacking? Do you want more labour points without monthly subscription? Increased leveling rates, or perhaps certain items? Worry not! we also have, you guessed it, an in-game premium store, where 1 item usually costs as much as the subscription fee!

Do you still remember when we first showed off the game with all its features saying how it will all be completely free and everyone will be able to enjoy them?(free meaning -->b2p, monthly fee or f2p with ingame store, no labour points nonsense)
*Slaps your face* HaHaHaHa you so funneh!

We actually planned to make it a mobile phone game, but phones can't handle cryengine, so we thought it'd be funny to put mobile mechanics into a pc game. Yes, like Ea did with Dungeon keeper online! Except, labour points only generate when offline if you have a subscription! So IMO it is 10 times better than mobile games, PROGRESS!!

reviewText: Please read this before considering the game. ArcheAge is the funnest MMO I have ever played, and I played World of Warcraft for three years straight. This game has provided the ability to meet new people and make a lot of new friends. However, there are some problems with this game. This game is very unfriendly for new players, if you haven't played an MMO previously then it might be a huge task to learn all the mechanics. Even as a MMO veteran, I've had to relearn and unlearn habits from previous games. ArcheAge is highly based on working with other players, this isn't a solo player experience. If you are keen on PvP, then I would highly suggest joining a guild and learning the basics from veteran players. I highly recommend giving ArcheAge a try, and if you decide on a Haranya continent race (Harani or Firran) and wish to join a guild based on helping new players and companionship contact me (Vavona) about joining the Neko Punch guild! Hope to see you in game!

reviewText:
ArcheAge is a game that could've been amazing but its potential was wasted.It has no story at all,which is kinda bad since they had the context for a great one.The lvling is awfull with repetitve quest format(kill x mobs/deliver something/gather x plant),generic npcs.Nothing except the sandbox aspect of the game is appealing.

Pro:

-sandbox elements
-class system is decent

Cons:

-boring quests/leveling
-too much focus on grinding
-crafting is way too expensive(e.g. to craft the lowest tier weapon u need arround 15g for maths and they escalate even more from tier to tier)
-pay-to-boost...if u pay money u get a huge huge advantage but u still reliant on rng
-too reliant on rng with no real way to obtain certain vital ingredients for crafting
-i call bs on the labor system(specially for f2p)
-this game requires way to much time if u really want to get decent gear
-dungeons are irrelevant for low lvl players including SM/PC
-pvp is bland

reviewText:
You know, it really is a shame. This game had a lot going for it. I can't express how disappointed I am.

I went into playing this game with little hope to begin with. Another lame F2P MMO. What can I say? I'm a die hard WoW fan that is rarely ever impressed, much less interested in anything else. Call it personal preference or obsession, whatever suits you. But after playing ArcheAge for a few weeks, I actually started to enjoy myself, little by little. Until I realized a few things about it.

For starters, this is not a F2P MMO. They like to make you think so. But if you want to do anything substantial in this game, you'd better have cash and be prepared to spend big. At the very least, you need a paid account if you want to get involved in trading profitably. That's a real downer for those who just wanted to enjoy the game they had marketed to them as F2P.

Another big hit that eventually lead me away from ArcheAge was the community. I played for several months on NA Calleil. I don't know how things are on all the other servers, but the community in Calleil is horrible. People are downright cruel to one another. As cool as some of the game mechanics are, it's the perfect set up for people to be hateful to their fellow players. If you want to keep any shred of faith in humanity, don't play.

I still maintain a small hint of interest, simply due to the naval side of the game. Let's face it, having your own boat is pretty damned cool. So you might just run across me, out there in the war torn waters, trying to catch a stupid fish that will probably get stolen along with my boat. But, don't count on it.

TL;DR ArcheAge is not F2P, ArcheAge kills faith in humanity.

reviewText:
ArcheAge is basically a p2qsb(pay to quasi-sandbox) game. If you're fine with that, then go ahead and play.
Just note that the combat is clunky, the optimalization is quite bad, and the PvP system makes the game unplayable(at times) for anyone playing solo or in a small guild. Also, the crafting interface can make your brain melt!
Of course not everything is bad - I'll admit that I did enjoy the sailing part of the experience, but after a month of playing the seas became crowded with hostile ships, which made it quite impossible to just chill on a boat...
Overall, would I recommend it? Maybe if you have a huge active pvp-oriented guild, and want to play together, but unless that's true, I won't.

reviewText:
UPDATE:  This review was written right before the game launched. That was before it mysteriously got removed from the Steam store. I no longer reccomend this game. I feel that it is fine if you don't fall into the RNG box trap. But, if you are a player who likes things fast, easily accessible, and/or like to collect in-game items, this is not the game for you. I played this game longer than the hours shown on here. I played it for about 6 months straight after launch. The continuous issues with communication between Trion, XLGames, and the community, made this game unplayable for me. I know there are those who will still enjoy it, and I'm happy for you. I wanted it to be more than it ended up being. Good luck to those still playing. <3

Pros:
- It allows you to customize your gameplay by giving you the freedom to mix three classes of your choice.  This means that if you wanted to, you could be an Archer/Mage/Rogue or a Warrior/Monk/Necro.  There are combinations that make the most sense and probably have the most synergy indicated by flame icons when you go to choose your second and third skillset" (class).  But

votesFunny: it's obvious who has paid attention to the skill info and who hasn't.  The combo system is incredibly rewarding if used correctly.  The amount of damage you do becomes less about having the "strongest" skill and more about reading through all of the skills and finding a combination that has synergy.\n\n- You get a mount before you hit level 10.  It will be in your quest log before you even notice.  While the game will be f2p

So

reviewText:
Note: I played this for months before it was released on steam.  I reached level cap, build my ship, farmed Hasla, etc... So ignore my 0.0 hrs logged on steam for this game. They were late to the party on getting it on steam.

Very innovative, but Dev's and the parent dev company are compeltely lost on what the community actually wants.

At its core, this MMO is BETTER than any other MMO.  It offers more in it's general idea.  The aspect of building your own ship from scratch, sailing the open seas, diving for treasure, exploring shipwrecks, and killing sea monsters... These things are groundbreaking to the MMO genre.

It has a very decent questing system that doesn't feel too grindy.  The class systems are very well done, and they avoid falling into the cookie-cutter rut of class building that 99% other MMO's fall into.  You really can play your way, choose your own skills, and build the class you want, as long as you play smart about it.

It does lack in some skill trees though.  I wish there were summoner type classes, as well as psionic/telekinetic types that never get any love.

Items are unrestricted, you can use anything.  You're given great freedom over how you want to play and theorycraft your character. This is another aspect where AA beats other MMO's.

The game looks great, and plays great. It's easy to get around, explore, do quests, form parties, etc.

Where the game fails is at its developement team.  They aren't doing a good job of protecting the game against botters or hackers.  They DO NOT listen to the community at all, no matter how they might try and comfort their fans on the forums.. It's often We'll say we'll fix it
date: but we will show we don't give a !@#$."\n\nA MAJOR problem with the game
recommended: that caused me to quit playing after reaching 50 is that there is not NEARLY enough housing space available.  And you need a house to craft properly
hoursPlayed: and you need to craft properly to build the ships you want
voteText: and weapons you want.  You can try to otherwise
helpfulPercent: but it will take you 10 times longer than everyone else. You will fall behind the curve
votesHelpful: and get smashed in PVP encounters.\n\nThe crafting of end-game items requires so many materials
votesTotal: it becomes a grindfest.  To the devs i say this: THIS ISN'T FUN!\n\nAll in all
votesFunny: you have a game that looks good
commentsCount: plays good
column16: sounds good
column17: and has a ton of content and options.. It's technically better than every other MMO out there.  But the way it's crafting and housing system has been designed is poorly balanced and is killing off numbers of players for the game.  And its supported by 2 dev teams (Trion and then AA's parent Korean Dev team) that can't make ends meet in providing support and care for their game.\n\nI can recommend playing through to level cap
column18: but don't get any big ideas of crafting a Black Pearl pirate ship
column19: or building a big house for yourself - Those are unrealistic ideas in this game.  Which is a shame because they are the funnest aspects.\n\nArcheAge really should have taken a page out of Ultima Online
column20: and really given more freedom to players on where to build houses and made land more available.\n\nWhat a giant let down... This game was supposed to revolutionize MMO's. and it could have.  But the dev's ruined that opportunity.  This could have been a WoW killer if they would have done it right."

reviewText: I will say this first and foremost, I loved this game. I waited for this game for so long. Think of the dream MMO... Fluid combat, pvp, pve, Housing, Crafting, Complex dungeons, Sailing, and a true sense of open world freedom. Unfortunately bad business practices and no care in the world about cheaters killed this game. Dont let my profile fool you. I was played this game through alpha, betas and launch. I spent 300$ on preorder for my copy and my wife. The cost in total just for apha between me and my friends was $1050. We had a great understanding of the game when launch hit, so we claimed tons of land. We grinded up to 50 (cap at the time) was doing all the dungeons, Mass pvp wars in freedich, had gallions, merchant ships. When Auroria content cameout Trion screwed up so bad that people en masse called for a game wide rollback. Then the hackers came. Now mind you this game has been released in Korea/Russia for a very long time. They (Trion) knew about the exploits for a very long time and did nothing about it. They made the excuse that they were only publishers and the developers have all the power, which is wrong. Hackers made out like bandits with hacks such as instantly Teleporting Trade packs to the drop off point making out like bandits. ESP and lvl 15-20  1 hitting max level chars. Botting was so bad that you could watch trails of bots grining mobs in hellswamp, with lvl 50 players protecting them when you tried to kill them. When you tried to do the right thing and report them, it cost you labor. Even thos that was going on we still played. Then Trion fought back in the dumbest way. They temp banned people who were caught hacking and they would gloat about how they talked their way out of a ban ( look in reddit). Then Trion punished people who were playing legit. It happened to my brother. My brother put a rare item on market worth 800g at the time which was a lot. Someone bought it. He logged on the next day and his gold was gone. He contacted a GM to find out what happened and to get his gold back. It turned out that someone who had hacked money bought the item and they took the gold from my bro and never gave the item back. Then there were the land snipers. Everyone would scour the land to look for a spot to build property. WHole groups of people would stand there waiting to put their plot down when another expired because of unpaid taxes. Hackers were there too, and would snach that land up quicker than a macro ! 1 guy would snatch 8-10 properties in a row, flip them and re sell them for a rediculous price. It got to the point where I had thousands of hours into the game, and I was tired of the Hacks and the store getting bloated with Pay to win items. I left, and my entire guild did as well. Fast foward a year, I see Archeage and I decide lemme give this one another try, maybe things have improved. I put 50 hrs into the game my second attempt, grinded about 4.3 million exp. Got a few of my friends back into it. The place is a ♥♥♥♥ing Ghost town now... places like Hasla where everyone would go to grind token for a higher teir weapon is empty. The Store is so bloated now with pay to win items its not funny. Now Trion is trying to move servers to combat the massive player losses they were hit with. One of the 1st things I noticed though was Hackshield was gone... they took it off. I literally watched 1 guy get 10 items regraded to Epic back to back. Server chat was buzzing with people talking about this guy that loggs on regrades items to epic and puts them on the market and loggs off. This was my personal most anticipated game period. I absolutley loved this game, I talked all my friends into it and they loved it. ARCHEAGE is probably the best if not the best MMOS out there. Having said that I will tell EVERYONE to never play this ♥♥♥♥ing game. This is the best example of a company literally milking the cow dry, and turning a blind eye to cheaters as long as they have revenue coming in.

reviewText:
Honestly? ArcheAge is a GOOD game. BUT it does have its flaws. Without a lot of the F2P elements in the game, this would be a much better title. Not to mention you kind of have to struggle through the early levels to actually have any fun.

I honestly love traveling in this game. The world is big and just looks good overall. Not to mention Boats are a LOT of fun. I recommend grinding through the first 15 levels mindlessly and find yourself a good guild.

FRIENDS ARE WHAT MAKE THIS GAME

Now on the other hand, this game can be a pain in the ♥♥♥. F2P is frustrating as hell when it comes to having to buy space for your bags. The only reason this isn't terrible is because you can buy them with gold at a relatively fair price.

I'm not a fanboy of this game, but I wont diss on it because it's easy to. It's a good game, you just need good people to play it with.

reviewText:
Ive read through many reviews and the biggest factor I've seen on negative comments about was the cash store and being able to buy things with real money.  I've played many P2W games and this one isn't that bad, gold is key here and you don't need to fork out real money to make gold in game. Buying gold out right also isn't possible, you can buy apex and sell them for gold in the market.  You do need  patron status if you want to own a house but also you don't need real money if you buy apex with gold from cash paying players listing them in the market your good to go.  If you have the time to make gold in game you never have to spend real money.  I do like that there is a cash store for players like myself that do not have the time to farm or spend hours a day to make gold in game.  I get a few hours of game time during the week and weekends is where i really get to spend most of my time gaming.

I'm really enjoying my time playing archeage. The graphics are great, and over all gaming i'm hooked.  There is so much to do, build and trade with other players that i'm always looking at my time and seeing that I've spent all my game time in what it seems to me in just a few min when hours have passed by.  I would recommend to people that are looking for a in depth game with a decent cash store.

Edit...
So after a few hundred hours of playing, i'm still enjoying this game quite a bit.  The seas are dangerous plan and simple, chances your going to get robbed is very high.  I suggest joining a guild to help, but even then its still a big possiblility your going to get robbed. One good thing is even if you lose your packs your trying to sell your given 20% of the profits the next day via mail.

reviewText:
Best MMO ever ruined by the west. I was extremely addicted to this when it first came out in the west, but it died shortly after a few months. The playerbase decreased significantly and it became more and more pay-to-win. At first it wasn't really pay to win, I could reach about level 45 without having to pay a single penny but the game is a lot more fun when you buy a Patron subscription.

The class system is what I liked most about the game. In other MMOs, once you select a class/profession, you're stuck with it unless you delete the character and start again. With this, you only need one character and you can simply change your class whenever you want. Vehicles, sailing, racing, farming, battles, even making music. This game had it all, and it's a shame that the west got everything a century after Korea and the east release new features.

The subscription system doesn't work here and the customer service is terrible. I wish I could love this game again but the playerbase is pretty dead, kinda like the game. It's too late to get into it now, plus the amount of foreigners who can't speak English is too annoying to deal with.

reviewText:
I finally managed to break free from this game. Heres my review:

If you pick this game up, expect this: Leveling to 1-50 will be easy, 50-55 will take as much as time as 1-50. You must buy patron before you can own farms/houses; Buy apex(from glyph store) in-game that will take ~1month of grinding or pay $$ for monthly sub.

You can craft endgame items, but gathering materials for them will take time and are expensive if choose to you buy them. RNG applied to one set of weapons/armors(extremely low chance to get highest tier, this will frustrate you).

If you wanna do actual damage in PVP/PVE, then get ready for the endgame gold sink: The infamous item grade regrading is in this game. Wanna increase chance of success? Then get ready to open wallet and buy those expensive charms. Epic grade is the endgame target. This is the most frustrating part of this game.

RNG is also applied in armor and weapon socketing.

Low on gold? You have 2 options: Go farm for gold from mobs OR buy some Apex(10$/10€) and/or some items from cash shop with real $$ and put them to AH to get quick gold. >.>

Expect to find lots of whales, botters, exploiters and hackers.

If you are planning to play this game as Free to play player than this game is NOT for you. Trust me, this game is everything but fair.

This game might look good in graphical point of view, but thats pretty much it.

This game had alot of potential, but poor game managment, excecution and heavy presence of cash shop ruined it.

reviewText:
I finally managed to break free from this game. Heres my review:

If you pick this game up, expect this: Leveling to 1-50 will be easy, 50-55 will take as much as time as 1-50. You must buy patron before you can own farms/houses; Buy apex(from glyph store) in-game that will take ~1month of grinding or pay $$ for monthly sub.

You can craft endgame items, but gathering materials for them will take time and are expensive if choose to you buy them. RNG applied to one set of weapons/armors(extremely low chance to get highest tier, this will frustrate you).

If you wanna do actual damage in PVP/PVE, then get ready for the endgame gold sink: The infamous item grade regrading is in this game. Wanna increase chance of success? Then get ready to open wallet and buy those expensive charms. Epic grade is the endgame target. This is the most frustrating part of this game.

RNG is also applied in armor and weapon socketing.

Low on gold? You have 2 options: Go farm for gold from mobs OR buy some Apex(10$/10€) and/or some items from cash shop with real $$ and put them to AH to get quick gold. >.>

Expect to find lots of whales, botters, exploiters and hackers.

If you are planning to play this game as Free to play player than this game is NOT for you. Trust me, this game is everything but fair.

This game might look good in graphical point of view, but thats pretty much it.

This game had alot of potential, but poor game managment, excecution and heavy presence of cash shop ruined it.

reviewText:
Honestly? ArcheAge is a GOOD game. BUT it does have its flaws. Without a lot of the F2P elements in the game, this would be a much better title. Not to mention you kind of have to struggle through the early levels to actually have any fun.

I honestly love traveling in this game. The world is big and just looks good overall. Not to mention Boats are a LOT of fun. I recommend grinding through the first 15 levels mindlessly and find yourself a good guild.

FRIENDS ARE WHAT MAKE THIS GAME

Now on the other hand, this game can be a pain in the ♥♥♥. F2P is frustrating as hell when it comes to having to buy space for your bags. The only reason this isn't terrible is because you can buy them with gold at a relatively fair price.

I'm not a fanboy of this game, but I wont diss on it because it's easy to. It's a good game, you just need good people to play it with.

reviewText:
Ive read through many reviews and the biggest factor I've seen on negative comments about was the cash store and being able to buy things with real money.  I've played many P2W games and this one isn't that bad, gold is key here and you don't need to fork out real money to make gold in game. Buying gold out right also isn't possible, you can buy apex and sell them for gold in the market.  You do need  patron status if you want to own a house but also you don't need real money if you buy apex with gold from cash paying players listing them in the market your good to go.  If you have the time to make gold in game you never have to spend real money.  I do like that there is a cash store for players like myself that do not have the time to farm or spend hours a day to make gold in game.  I get a few hours of game time during the week and weekends is where i really get to spend most of my time gaming.

I'm really enjoying my time playing archeage. The graphics are great, and over all gaming i'm hooked.  There is so much to do, build and trade with other players that i'm always looking at my time and seeing that I've spent all my game time in what it seems to me in just a few min when hours have passed by.  I would recommend to people that are looking for a in depth game with a decent cash store.

Edit...
So after a few hundred hours of playing, i'm still enjoying this game quite a bit.  The seas are dangerous plan and simple, chances your going to get robbed is very high.  I suggest joining a guild to help, but even then its still a big possiblility your going to get robbed. One good thing is even if you lose your packs your trying to sell your given 20% of the profits the next day via mail.

reviewText:
I'm going to say yes to recommending this game because I like it more than I hate it. I'll tell you the bad, then the good.

To start, this game makes you grind in your quests. You spend A LOT of time doing one quest when there are plenty of other games that would let you advance in level MUCH more quickly. When I first started this game, I would play with my boyfriend (OH MY GOD A GIRL ON THE INTERNET WHO KNEW THE LEGENDS WERE TRUE) and he would get REKT so much by ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s who wanted the goods he was transporting for the quest he was doing at the time. The community has died down a little since then, and there aren't as many of those ♥♥♥♥♥♥ as there were at the start.

The reason I would recommend this game is because the world is HUGE and the amount of quests to do is pretty much endless. You can choose from an assortment of races, and depending on the race you choose, you ACTUALLY start off on DIFFERENT CONTINENTS! How freaking cool is that!? AND to get to the other continent you can actually cross the freaking OCEAN. YEAH. THAT'S RIGHT. YOU CAN SAIL THE SEAS AND BE A PIRATE IF YOU WANT TO. But don't. You'd be one of those ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s I mentioned earlier. This game is insanely fun, and even though I only have about 14 hours on it, it never gets old. It's probably my only favorite MMORPG I play.

reviewText:
I dont normally write reviews or if I do there not normally incredibly long. But I personally have felt like I should because I've seen what this game was and what it could become, and then I watched it fall apart.

Now this IS NOT a bad review and most people who've played this would ask why. Well I still think that this game could become much better then it is now so I've decided to write this review, redownload and get back into it. I mean think about it everyone from those who've played to those who have yet to. Name another game that you can go from farming crops, or running goods from one city to another (be it by airship, land or sea) to make profit, and then go to war and fight against an entire faction of people that have the freedom to do the exact same. Now I understand that a good chunk of the game was taken out by hackers and botters, and I understand that Trions devs could do more. Trust me I've lived through it. But we shouldent label this game poor because of its failings, especially if theres someone out there looking for a game like this. I'm for sure not also saying throw all your money at Trion in hopes that they *fix* it, but I believe that there will be a time that this game will come back. And be that one MMORPG that we all wanted it to be.

So I guess check it out if you dont like it then you can blame me for anytime you lost playing this game.

This game resembles a rootkit trojan virus! It allocates 26gigs and only downloads/installs 10gigs.  Antivirus went nuts and trottled my drives' read and write speed simultaneously locking my system.


You MUST dissable your Real-Time Hardware Scanning while installing this game catch the virus! Myself and three of my friends all had the same problem when installing this game. The game will download and possibly become playable... It may pause for hours at 100% while unable to play or at some point the game seems to dissapear and you'll be prompted to download and install it again...
Dissabling Real-Time Hardware Scanning will allow you to play the game but you will catch the Virus. Manually delete these folders +
steamapps/common/archeage
steamapps/downloading/304030
steamapps/temp/304030
Sometimes a folder called Archeage will apear on your ROOT drive. Delete it.

Then remove it from your library by right clicking the title and selecting delete local content.

Then open device manager > View + View hidden Devices > Non Plug and Play> Delete eaglex64 and RESTART!

reviewText:
The game itself is of an amazing quality, BUT!!! The F2P model is very similar to cellphone games: Lots and LOTS of waiting.
Everything you do ingame costs Labor points: to open pouches from enemies, cut down trees, mine ore, crafting, etc. If you play for free, you get 5 points every 5 minutes ONLY if you are online. If you pay however, you get 10 labor points every 5 minutes even if offline.
You want to mine the iron ore over there? NOPE, gotta wait 10 minutes before you have enough labor points. You want to craft a silly quest item? Tough luck buddy, you will need 100 labor points. Even if you subscribe, the waiting for labor point ruins the whole experience.

If you want to play it for free, the only way you can do stuff is by leaving your game open to stack labor points.

On a last note, everything in the cash shop is way overpriced to be worth your while.

TL:DR Great game, horrible f2p system that ruins the whole experience. I would recommend if it were a subscription-only based game with no labor points and no cash shop. Unfortunately, there seems to be plenty of cash whales that doesn't mind throwing money hundreds of $ at a time.

reviewText:
I really wanted to like this game. I really did. The world is very well-developed, the playable races are interesting (this is the first game that made me actually want to play an elf, for instance), and the class system is pretty neat and varied. And I absolutely love to make things in these games.

However, if you're on a free account, there's much less stuff to do than appears to be out there. I suppose that's fair- after all, you get what you pay for. I do wish, however, that the game had told me my limitations going out of the gate, instead of, for example, cheerfully handing me a quest to build something and then informing me when I tried to fill it that building things was an activity limited to paying players only. For another example, the help message at the bottom of the server select screen tells players that they can have six characters total, with a maximum of four on any given server- this isn't the case for free players, who can only have two characters total. Another small thing, but I'd have appreciated some accuracy.

Then there's the Labor system; there's no reason for it to be run the way it is unless the developers wanted to limit crafting to paying players only. I'm fine with effectively not being able to craft items, but then the designers somehow worked enemy drops into the crafting system. That's right, you have to spend Labor to collect any in-game currency from defeating enemies, which is the thing that angered me about ArcheAge. I tend to play MMOs in short bites, so I'm not online nearly long enough at a stretch for my Labor pool to replenish itself to a workable level, and with every foe I kill, and there are a lot of them, I get another useless coinpurse (at level 15 or so where I am, they cost 2 Labor apiece to open, which doesn't seem so bad, but then higher-level" coinpurses are dropped that cost 20 Labor or so to open).

Again
date: my opinion may not matter much
hoursPlayed: but I really dislike being locked out of things that were advertised to me as being available to everyone."

reviewText: This game was great in the beginning, It was really fun and I enjoyed the sandbox and class system and being able to truly customize your character to be truly unique. Going out on a ship was fun even with a few bugs (game mechanics) here and there.....then as you get to the end game, you realize how much this game really suffers from an extreme case of 'pay to win' disease. Sure it had been improved in a recent patch, but it still requires alot of real money transactions (unless you spend your entire life in the game grinding gold or selling crafts) RNG is not on your side most of the time. Sadly a huge time and money sink that doesn't live up to the entertainment value. Maybe it will improve, maybe it will get better in time, but by then, I think we'll be playing a new and better MMO. Black Desert anyone?

reviewText:
I really wanted to love this game.  The costumes are beautiful and I managed to get almost every RNG box mount with very little actual money spent.  I was lucky enough to grab enough land to drop a mansion (if I had bothered farming the gilda for a design) during launch.  PVP those first couple of months was so much fun and the hope PVP could be like that again is pretty much what kept me playing for almost a year.

Alpha/Beta/early launch were all simply glorious.  Roughly three months in AA turned to crap, progressively worse every day.  I was really fortunate to have not been a big enough chump to swipe hard for gear and any time I found myself tempted to I would take a step back and evaluate how hard the game was dying which made it very easy to spend my money elsewhere.  My total money wasted over the year playing was less than $250 (archeum founders pack being the only large purchase, the rest small cash shop transactions/gifts to friends) which is about $2000+ less than almost everyone else I was playing with near the end.

I would never inflict this mess on anyone I actually want to stay friends with.

reviewText:
Customer support doesn't exist in this game. Not even if you are a paying customer. Bought the game when it was released in Europe. Spent some money on it here and there. One would think Trion wants to keep paying customers.

Nope.

They don't give a ♥♥♥♥.

And neither should you.

Archeage is the typical grindy Asian MMORPG with bad game mechanics and a super-mega-very-very-pay-to-win cash shop model.

Ingame actions require you to have Labor Points (LP). Free to play players only regenerate a small, tiny fraction of the LP compared to subscribers or people who spend real money on Labor Point shops. Want to pick up a flower? Loot a mob? Sell something on the AH? Craft something? Build a trade pack? Get a ship? Open a chest? You better buy some labor points!

Checked the game's features? You can build trade packs and turn them in for gold or resources. Cool huh?
Nope. It's a big fat ♥♥♥♥ing noobtrap.
Crafting?
Noobtrap.
Uhh... You can get a house and grow ♥♥♥♥ and raise animals!
Nope. Noobtrap.
If you want to maximize your earnings, you need to grind 432534 of the same low level mobs and open their purses for archeum. That's basically the game. Enjoy.

reviewText:
I have fought countless battles, I have made hundreds of traderuns across the lands, I have won and I have lost.
Archeage was an amazing game, but what happened? Honestly I don't know... It just lost the feeling for me. I played during Alpha aswell. Spendt Pretty much 70% of my game time there, and for what? To have my character deleted and for me to start over again.

Archeage tried its best to be unique, and some places it succeeded, but its just way to repetetive. Go here, kill that, go back, get another quest, kill that etc.
But if you ignore this, and try to have fun with friends and do traderuns or maybe robb someone it can be alot of fun. I remember playing with one of my good friends, and we used to do traderuns all day, we got robbed several times but we still enjoyed it.

But here is a huge mistake I think with the game. IT IS SO GRINDY. So you get something called Guilda stars, wich are used to buy blueprints for stuff like ships and houses, these are pretty much impossible to get after you do the main missions that ends roughly at level 30. After this you do F***ING DAILY QUESTS THAT GIVE YOU ONE GUILDA STAR PER DAILY..... or you can do traderuns to the enemy country and earn one guilda star per package...


I really wish this game was different, I had some awesome and epic adventures in this game. But im afraid I just can't recommend this game (even if its free).

Final verdict

3/10

reviewText:
Ive really gotten into this game. Its true at its core its pay to win. Having the top end gear probably means dropping a fair wad of cash or a great deal of your time on the game..

However!.. The game is fun, you can have great fun with this game without spending a penny. Although I would reccomend if you enjoy the game then dropping some pennys on patron access is a good idea, at least for the first month.

Everything in the cash shop can be purchased with ingame gold using the Apex system but this is also where the pay to win comes in. Gold can be purchased from other players using the Apex system.

Long story short. Its free to play, dropping money will make you advance faster but ultimatly this is a fun game even ifyou dont spend a penny.

Tip: Find a guild!

reviewText: Lots of people bash on this game. I'm not saying it doesn't have its problems, but all games do. I however love this game. I started free to play and worked by way to being able to buy patron with in game gold and have been able to keep it since. There is so much to do in this game. You can trade on the high seas or be a pirate. You can be the lead fighter in your guild or be a lone fisherman for the entire game. The farming and crafting system is one of the best I've seen and gives you so much variety. This game is not for casual gamers though. It takes a long time to level and get the gear necessary to hold your own in combat. If you want to play for free, there is lots of time involved to get the gold needed for patron. If you love immersive games that give you lots to do every day, this game is for you.

reviewText:
Time I write a legitimate official guide regarding this game.
I found the game enjoyable at times, sometimes not so enjoyable due to new games getting released, and some other unlucky ingame events :P
The game is named ArcheAge, if you forgot the game's name, it's a sandbox mmorpg game type, containing an immersive enviroment, from temperate climates to desertic , cold, vulcanic climate.
As you begin your game, you'll have to choose from 4 characters, which have their unique abilities, Example : the elf can swim faster and stay underwater for a little more compared to others, the Nuian human builds faster, The Cat guy from haranya continent gets less fall damage, and the Haranya man brings the worldgate teleporter faster than the other races.
After that. you'll have to choose a main skill set : from Sorcery , the pure magic damage to Battlerage, the full physical damage. There are over 140 class combinations, because after level 5, respectively level 10, you get to choose 2 more skillsets, and get your own class title : Example : Arcanist, Demologist, Revenant, Stone Arrow, Templar, Gypsy, Shaman, Blighter, .
Yes ! I've level up my character, now what?
Call your friends, cooperate, make a 'family' and decide what things you want achieved, example Player x wants to build a house and be alchimist, you want to build a ship and focus on cooking, crafting, machining proficiency activities.
It's a free game, yes, but you can't access the whole experience without paying. MY FRIEND YOU ARE WRONG!!.
You can make alot of gold for free, and buying some coins named APEX, granting 1250 credits. the amount required to get patron is 2500 credits If I remember, and you can get patron for free, and as you have patron *5000 labor cap, faster xp drop* you regenerate 5 labor while offline, 10 while online. you can use the patron for different activities that get you gold. in 1 week you can buy patron for two months. Get some gear. it's easy

Now, I'll put some pictures REGARDING MY CURRENT AFVENTURE IN ARCHEAGE!. THINGS YOU CAN DO FOR FREE!!!!!

Going out on a ship was fun even with a few bugs (game mechanics) here and there.....then as you get to the end game, you realize how much this game really suffers from an extreme case of 'pay to win' disease. Sure it had been improved in a recent patch, but it still requires alot of real money transactions (unless you spend your entire life in the game grinding gold or selling crafts) RNG is not on your side most of the time. Sadly a huge time and money sink that doesn't live up to the entertainment value. Maybe it will improve, maybe it will get better in time, but by then, I think we'll be playing a new and better MMO. Black Desert anyone?

reviewText:
OK For the most part, this game is excellent. The concept is great, the mechanics are nifty, and the class change system is super flexible.

However, there's one thing that ruined this game for me: The Community.

If you're the type of person who doesn't mind PVP, then by all means. If you get off on trolling other people in whatever ways you can find, even people on your own faction, ArcheAge is perfect.

However? If you're a carebear" like me who only wants to PVP on my own terms? Stay away because the people of this game will eat you alive.

4.5/10 would not get ganked or have my cart stolen again."

reviewText:
The P2W isn't what drove me away. It's the god-awful crafting system. Crafting is tiered and requires the previous version of something in order to craft a better version of it.

Want that level 50 staff? First craft a level 20 staff, then upgrade it to the level 25 staff, then to the level 30 staff, and so on and so forth. Each new version needs a bunch of different hard-to-get materials and it's obnoxious. Now imagine doing the same thing for all your different armor slots.

To compound the problem, you can't just harvest everything you need for crafting. Some things can only be gotten from trade runs. Other things have to be crafted from other professions. The prices for everything are so inflated that oftentimes buying the oil you need to make that leather armor negates the profitability of crafting it yourself. You might as well just buy the armor of the AH.

It's just uselessly complicated and absurd. If I could harvest everything I needed, and didn't need the 10 previous versions of a piece of gear to make that gear, I would love this game. But the crafting system as it is right now just enrages me. I can't take it anymore.

It's a shame because I enjoy most other things about the game. With MMO's it's always that one boneheaded design decision that ruins it for me, and in ArcheAge it's the crafting.

reviewText:
As you can see, I have over 2,000 hours.... wish I could get those hours back.

The game itself is a very beautiful world that you are able to play any class with any type of combination.  Going out to fish, doing a trade run, or even find questing going on.  There is quite a bit to do in this game... but the company Trion could learn a bit more customer service.  Finding out now that one of the four later servers released will be merged together and will have lost of land and such.  Not a game you can really merge servers without you loosing your farm plot and house.

Pros
Beautiful World
Great Classes Combos
Decent Character customaztion
Good amount of Land to explore
Fishing
Trade Runs
Houses (but need to sub)
Farming (need to sub)

Cons
Need to subscribe to own land and farming which is a big part of the game.
Cannot use Auction House without subscribing.
Toxic Players
Poor Customer Service from Trion if you have problem.
Quest become repeative.
Huge amount of exploits.
Story feels short.
Character Customization is limited to face only.
Some of the releases for the game feel out of order.
Feels like paid to win.
Hack Shield does not remove correctly when you uninstall the game.

Would I recommend this to anyone?  I would not.  I would not go back if someone paid for me to return.

reviewText:
Archeage, Archeage, Archeage, why did it have to go so wrong?
I'm not going to ramble on about every single detail of this game, plenty of other people have. I'm just writing this for the sake of personal closure.
Archeage could have been THE MMO. THE WoW killer. The be-all-and-end-all of MMOs. I'm well aware that the title I just said has been given to MANY MMOs, (SWToR, ESO, TERA), but if you have played Archeage (And I do recommended playing the first 15 levels, then you'll truly understand what this review is saying) you'll know that Archeage was destined to be the real WoW killer. THE MMO.

So where did it go wrong?
It's funny how just a small little thing can ruin such a magnificant example. The fact that this game is free killed it. In order for this game to be free, Trion had to burden it down with microtransactions.  And what a mistake that was. In order to fit in with the crowd of free to play MMOs, Trion felt it would be a good idea to make the game free, when a simple $15 per month sub fee would have been well justified with how much content and opportunity this game had.
Everything in this game either costs money to enjoy or isn't worth doing. The housing system? Costs money. Auction house? Costs money. Farming? Costs money. simple things such as crating and getting loot? Costs money.
Even the things that don't cost money aren't worth doing because this game has no hope for it left. Its playerbase is gone, and whoever is left is either a new player or a bot.

Hopefully someday soon another game like this will pop up without the colossal failure of what this game did wrong.

reviewText:
TRY THIS GAME FOR YOURSELF.

So many negative reviews so I'll just say this.  I stopped playing this game twice, only because it took up my whole life.  I have far more hours on it than my steam says, truthfully, I've hardly played on steam and I have 434 hours logged.  There is one thing I'd like to say.

THERE IS NOTHING YOU CANNOT DO IN THIS GAME EVEN IF YOU CHOOSE NOT TO OPEN YOUR WALLET.  THIS GAME IS 100% F2P.

I have seen far worse in games than the pay system in this one.  This one is only hindering on your ability to own housing/crafting, but thats easily managable.  As you advance in a craft, the labor costs decrease as well, making some things that where not effective earlier, something you can sell to make money now.

People say you can't make money when your not patron(subscriber) and I disagree.  I always have enough money for patron status within a week using the formula at the bottom of this review to craft via buying and selling things from the AH.

Now it is true, when you first start playing, you cannot access the AH without an AH license.  My first playthrough I saved up money for 2x APEX and bought patron which removes the need for the AH license, but I still picked one up later.  That one barrier is a hinderence but does not make that game unplayable, as by the time you reach max level, or maybe even halfway to max level, you should have enough money from fighting alone to get a single apex for an AH license.  I'll post the formula for making money at the bottom.

HIGHLIGHTS
_______________________________________________________________________________
TRUE OPEN WORLD

1.GLIDERS!!!!  This game has so many fantastic design elements I've never seen anywhere else.  First of all GLIDERS!  OMG GLIDERS...Every game I've ever played since this game, has me trying to double jump to pull out my glider.  You are MEANT to explore every nook and cranny of this game.  There are even achivement" awards for finding specific areas and even if nothing is in a place

I wish there were a lot more types of ships as well but they did a fantastic job there.  The physics on ships can make you laugh sometimes too when they go to right themselves.  Although I wish there was more of a reason to leave a ship out and/or docked.  There's a button that makes it so no one can steal your ship

Here is the forumla for making money.

SP() x (AHT) = G ()  //Selling Price(SP) x AuctionHouseTax(AHT) = how much Gold you get back (G)
G() - MC() = SP()    //G - Material Cost(MC) = Single Profit(SP)

1000/LC() = TC()     //1000 / Labor Cost(LC) = Total Crafts per labor potion(TC)

TC() x SP() = TP()   //TotalCrafts x SingleProfit = Total Profit(TP)
TP() - LPC() = NP()   //Total Profit(TP) - Labor Potion Cost(LPC) = Net Profit(NP)

If your Net Profit is in the positive

reviewText:
I played a several hundred hours of this after launch (while it had departed from the Steam client), attaining max level and playing most of the end game at the time.

Archeage is an unfortunate blend of Farmville and Skyrim. While beautiful to look at, little impactful story and imbalanced abilities make it impractical to strive to pass through the high levels of grind needed to subsist, let alone thrive. The game desperately tries to hide the fact that anything you can grind can more easily be aquired through payment, though some high tier items can only be purchased.

Simply put, as many others have said, if you wanted a Pay-to-Win Farmville game with RPG elements in the Crysis engine, then play this game. Otherwise? Avoid this game and enjoy something like Guild Wars 2, Final Fantasy XIV, WoW, or any other numerous MMOs that do the genre justice.

reviewText:
You will enjoy the game this way but you will soon encounter Credi Card Warriors/ Visa Champions. [/quote]

I think this is the biggest problem with the game.. they should never have introduced a cash shop and simply made it subscription based.

The ability for individuals to drop large sums of money to get a competitive advantage is what makes it feel like it's pay to win.

If I pay a monthly subscription, I expect the game to be balanced around equal effort, not who sells the most apex/cash shop items.

I had no problem with the grind, but when you add in the RNG (AA has one of the toughest rng sets I've played.. it really is a luck grind),  the fact that your items can be destroyed when upgrading (regrade charms reduce this and at higher levels, they are required to progress without spending a fortune) and then the ability for people to simply sell apex and outright buy high end items. It makes the game feel pay to win.. not just pay to progress faster.

The worst part is that as a subscriber.. Your already paying a sub, then you still feel like the game is pay to win at endgame.

None of these issues will affect you heavily as a you are leveling, so its a fun game up until endgame, where you realize its almost impossible to progress without subscribing and swiping your visa.  That is the double dipping that really annoyed me about their cash shop model.
